I love this jacket. The fit is really comfortable and slouchy but not boxy. This is one of the few denim jackets I've ever worn that isn't tight around my biceps. The quality is good - no wrinkling. As long as I don't stain it, I'll keep it for a while - it's just so versatile.
Best light weight summer jacket. Wore this every day on my vacation. Definitely will rent again and potentially buy.

links_reviews_title: Wore this a bunch! Great spring transition jacket
links_reviews_text: I ended up wearing this jacket a bunch of times and almost bought it! Will definitely rent again

links_reviews_title: Not the right fit for me :(
links_reviews_text: Rented this for vacation but didn't end up bringing it because it has an odd fit. Runs large and has a lot of fabric making it look for poofy.

links_reviews_title: Perfect light jacket to wear over a dress
links_reviews_text: I wore this on vacation over a dress when it got chilly at night and it was perfect! It's a great light denim-ish material and a great cut. I would normally order a small in this style of jacket but sized down based on reviews and the XS fit perfectly. I'd definitely recommend sizing down one size.
Cut for shorter torso or bigger chest

links_reviews_title: Nice alternative to a basic denim jacket.
links_reviews_text: Looks best zipped because the lapels are a little odd.
Wanted to love this white jacket, but the small was too big, which made it unflattering, and I was surprised by the buttons at the wrist.

Maybe would have been better in a size down but the stiffness of the material surprised me. Had more of a painters clothing material that wasn't particularly comfortable or flattering. Was excited about the jacket but returned before I wore it.
Great lightweight denim jacket. Just as described and can mix and match with anything

links_reviews_title: I wanted to love this jacket
links_reviews_text: This jacket is extremely oversized. I thought it would fit like a fitted jean jacket but it was very baggy. Also it has black buttons on the cuffs that look like they don't belong.
Way to big and stiff. Returned.

links_reviews_title: Very stylish, wore it to throw over everything this spring!
links_reviews_text: Runs a bit big, I wish I would've ordered a small. Perfect lightweight stylish jacket!
I almost always wear a small (2/4) but this jacket in a small was very baggy with wide arms and not at all flattering. Did not wear.

links_reviews_title: Cute but way too big on me.
links_reviews_text: Way to big. Needed an XS not a Small
I accidentally rented the large — a medium would fit me better — but this jacket still looks super cute. I'll definitely rent it again!

This jacket has the boyfriend/oversized fit. Overall I liked the way it looked but it felt a little bulky and stiff. The pop of white is nice for cooler spring weather but the material felt bleached out.
Fits like any jean jacket should, slightly slouchy. Moto style makes it fun. Good transition weight.
fits oversized, super casual

links_reviews_title: This jacket can go with a lot of different things and colors.
links_reviews_text: The jacket was cute and comfortable, but ft a little bit large.
I wore size 4 but arm length was too short. I had to wear a black blouse underneath to show cuffs. It worked and it was a nice black and white contrast.

links_reviews_title: I wore for work events. Comfortable and professional.
links_reviews_text: Nice contrast with a black dress. Not too heavy. Perfect for fall weather.

Beautiful tweed blazer in the perfect summer weight. Wore this to work a couple of times and also out on a date. It is the perfect piece to transition from workday to evening. Would definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Very chic and elegant. Gives your work outfit a little flavor.
links_reviews_text: Loved it, because it reminded me of a Chanel peice I've been eyeing. Definitely spring worthy, didn't make me too hot. I love the flare bottom.
Beautiful fit, cute jacket, nice tweed, nice weight, not itchy. Zipper detail nice change as well.
Got this to wear to school and work but ended up wearing it to a concert and found it to pull my entire outfit together. I loved the fitted, tailored look that accentuated my waist.

I wore this jacket to work over a black dress. It's really cute but it shed really badly. Maybe it's worse because the jacket is still so new, but I went through a lot of lint sheets cleaning up. Runs a bit big in the shoulders, but then again, I think Rebecca Taylor generally does run big. I rented both a 2 and 4 and chose to wear the 2.
Great work top. Very professional but also flattering and cute. Wore it zipped up with black pants and got lots of compliments.
Very cute. Wore black slacks with it to work. Material not that thick. Would rent again. True to size.
Solid fit, good quality, nice piece

links_reviews_title: Beautiful jacket - a little short in the arms.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful jacket that looked great with a black dress for Court. I wore my usual jacket size, which was fine everywhere except the arms, which were a little short and exposed the lining.
Great coat worn for networking function. Easy to move in- not stiff or heavy like most tweeds. Super soft. Ran slightly small but wore normal size.
Looks nice, fits kinda tight with no stretch
I got this for a big interview to wear with a black dress. I kept it zipped up and it made for a very professional look. It has a flattering shape.

links_reviews_title: Great jacket for work, extremely comfortable, very lightweight
links_reviews_text: This jacket looks great! Much lighter material than I expected, which made it great for wearing all day at work without getting too hot. More ruffly at the bottom than I think the photos show.

links_reviews_title: Adds flare to a simple outfit!
links_reviews_text: I really love the style of this jacket and it works with so many different outfits. I am normally a size 6 but have a bigger bust so chose to order an 8 and it fits perfect. A little short in the arms when you raise them up but otherwise a great fit. Very flattering and will definitely order again!
This fit me perfectly and am considering buying! It was perfect for work and looked amazing and received lots of compliments! Highly recommend!
I rented this for work and it's super versatile! I would rent it again.
I wore this to work. I was pretty warm but comfortable most of the day - 60 degree temps outside. The shoulders are very pronounced, which can seem strange if you aren't used to it (like me!).

Loved this. Feels high quality and looks classic and elegant. Runs true to size, and I liked the slimmer fit, but if you are bigger in the shoulder or arms sizing up might be more comfortable for a little room.
Easy to wear with everything!
Ordered for work. I wore it twice. It is soft on the inside, fits great and looks good with so many different things. If it wasn't so $$ I would buy. I want in my closet for every work trip
Classic look, trim, tailored look. Very pretty.
Fit great, elegant
Definitely fits slim in arms, if you are on verge of two sizes, size up.

links_reviews_title: Cute and professional. I received several complements at work.
links_reviews_text: Nicely tailored at the waist to avoid feeling too boxy
Pros: Super soft, not too thick so didn't make me hot. Worn with black top and pants. Cons: Sleeves are a bit short. Also, I wore a size up from my usual size and it it well.
Thought it was going to be small but fit well even zipped up. Make plain black pants and black blouse look chic and put together. Will definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: A great transitional piece going from one event to another from sleek to professional office
links_reviews_text: Slim fit on arms, very flattering with a textured weave which gave a little without bunching or wrinkling
Great early spring work jacket. More fun than your normal blazer. Paired with black pants and flats.

As other reviewers noted, this was too tight around the arms so could not wear it (I rented 6 and I'm between 4-6). Nice springy material but I recommend you size up. Also, length was a bit short for my liking even if I was able to wear it. I don't recommend this for people with large chest area or pair shape.
Gorgeous jacket, perfect transitional item for work to evening. Such a classic and elegant look. Highly recommend.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful jacket for work or weekend!
links_reviews_text: Wore it over a LBD and with black pants or jeans. Versatile piece.
I wore this for a meeting at work with jeans and received a ton of compliments. If the jacket wasn't so expensive, I would probably buy it, so I'm glad I can rent it with RTR!
I am 5-11 and the arms were cut just too short.
n/a
Cute, a little tight on the shoulders. Great for work
Perfect fit and tons of compliments!!

links_reviews_title: Great looking jacket but ran really small
links_reviews_text: The jacket had good quality material and the cream color was pretty. The reason it is rated low is because the size was so off. I am a consistent size 4 or 6 in Rebecca Taylor but the size 6 jacket fit like a 2; narrow in the sleeves and across the back.
Fits true to size.

links_reviews_title: Looking cute & sheltering in place can totally coexist
links_reviews_text: The perfect lounge/WFH dress that made me feel hip at the same time.

Good casual sporty dress. Comfy. This dress is TTS but is designed to be loose fitting. A tad too loose. That combined with it falling below my knee at 5ft7 means I would suggest some may want to size down/avoid.
Really cute everyday outfit
This dress is the perfect everyday athleisure piece. I would absolutely buy it, just in a smaller size. Runs large!
This dress runs very large. I wish I got an xs. Overall it was good for a weekend outfit with friends. There wasn't much style to it otherwise
I lived in this for days. I'd buy it if it wasn't so pricey, as it is quite basic and doesn't feel particularly high-end. But it's cut perfectly for me and was great with boots and sneakers.

links_reviews_title: I liked this dress a lot and thought it was super comfy
links_reviews_text: It's great for an everyday dress
Wore this dress with my wedge shell top Adidas. I will probably rent in again in the spring.
great for going to soccer games and walking around the mall. It's like wearing a longer t-shirt :-) very happy with it
I absolutely loved this dress. Of course, then there was the question of what shoes to wear with it? Too matchy to wear adidas and adidas?? LOL

links_reviews_title: Rented for everyday but I did not wear it.
links_reviews_text: For me, the shape and length of this dress is really weird. MAYBE it'll work for taller girls 🤔
Wore it on a flight from DC to LA. Super comfortable, but still stylish. Allowed me to hop off the plane and immediately start vacationing while still looking good.
I wore this to work and out to dinner with friends and received a ton of compliments. It's comfortable and very flattering
I worked it with a big link share chain belt and it looked great. Super comfortable. I loved it.

links_reviews_title: Really cute and comfy dress - too loose fitting for anything other than super casual
links_reviews_text: Would rent for a different loungey occasion

links_reviews_title: Nice but too wide for my face
links_reviews_text: The glasses were great but too wide for my face. I couldn't wear them for long because of this. The style is very cool though.

links_reviews_title: Great glasses-wish I could buy them!
links_reviews_text: Got these to bring myself some cheer while social distancing. These sunglasses were great and didn't take up half my face. I wore them on a walk and they provided a good amount of sun protection for my eyes. I would totally buy these is they weren't over $300
Loved these!!
I'm so upset that I didn't buy these! I wore them several times, and they never stretched out or sagged. They have the perfect amount of stretch and are very soft. Love!!

links_reviews_title: Super comfy but weird in the back
links_reviews_text: These jeans felt like super soft leggings when I put them on. Sooooo soft! But, I felt like the back pockets were positioned weird and made everything look wide and flat. I asked my husband and he even said it looked weird. The length was great for me at 5'3". They weren't too thick for a warm summer day. I could've worn these all day. But those pockets and the way it made my butt look was the driving force in deciding to return these. Otherwise I probably would've purchased them to keep.
Love the Madewell brand and these jeans! They are super comfortable.
Jeans were good and stretchy while still feeling like solid denim
Best jeans ever! High waisted with stretch.
Fit very well. A little too high waisted for me otherwise I would have purchased them.

links_reviews_title: I am in love with these. So in love I wanted to buy them but they stretched out after one wear.
links_reviews_text: so soft and comfy. They did stretch after wearing and I wished I had sized down.
I'm 5'4" and usually wear a 6 and the 27 was a perfect fit and they weren't too long! Didn't stretch out over the day
Loved how comfortable these jeans were!
good fit, good quality

I've been searching around for new jeans and wanted to try a few before I buy. I loved these jeans! I'm a 27/28 usually so these were slightly big but I still wore them several times. Will definitely rent again in a smaller size

links_reviews_title: Sort and comfortable but not the most flattering
links_reviews_text: The jeans were really soft and comfortable but definitely too long - I ended up having to roll them at the bottom. The length made them bunch in weird places and they ended up being pretty unflattering.

Really liked these jeans-I ordered a size larger than I needed because of availability. Now I'm waiting for them to be back in my actual size so I can snap them up again. Like them enough that I'm considering buying a pair. The waist is high enough to let me wear some of the shorter tops that are in style right now without flashing tummy, which I appreciate.

I liked these jeans - knew they would be higher rise than I normally wear but was surprised at just how high they felt. Once I got used to them, I liked them. The color was pretty, they were so soft - only issue was they stretched out after wearing and got fairly saggy. I'd try a smaller size next time.

links_reviews_title: Rented these for work, but wore them 3 days straight.
links_reviews_text: Super high waisted, loved the fit. Madewell jeans fit me great.
Great pant and great fit - quality issue with the seam but otherwise adorable!!!
Stretchy but holds u in!
Cute and easy fit

links_reviews_title: Loved them so much I bought them
links_reviews_text: I cannot imagine life without these jeans. So comfortable you can lay on the couch with them but they never get baggy. Super cute!!
The fit was good however the jeans did stretch out over time. I did have to keep pulling them up.

I really wanted to love these jeans.. they were soft, lightweight, a perfect length for petites, and even a nice deep blue, BUT the back pockets made my butt look ummm just.. bad? Not big in a good way big in an oddly shaped wiiiiiiide way. Did not wear.

These are cute, but they run a little big. I tend to like my high waisted pants to be a bit tighter. They were shorter than I thought they would be but really comfy. Someone asked me if I was pregnant while I was wearing them.
I really love Madewell's high rise jeans, but don't understand why they're $135, so I rented these. Pretty standard jean, nice high rise, not a ton of stretch.
The jeans were comfortable and were a flattering fit.

These jeans are incredible. They fit pretty true to size - I rented my regular size (27) and they fit perfectly. The length was perfect for a shorter person (I'm 5'0") to be regular length, and I'm guessing it's pretty cropped for anyone taller. The material is super stretchy and the waist was perfectly high for my taste. I might just buy them at this point!
Super soft material

links_reviews_title: this coat is comfy and I love it
links_reviews_text: This is basically a blanket, I love it, just long enough for petite without being too long. It's not for sub-35 days but other than that it rules
Super cozy warm and comfy. Good for tall. Frumpy but not in a bad way.
Was just OK. Great for a weekend of running errands and kept me warm in the brisk fall, but not particularly flattering .

I really wish I could afford to buy this coat! It's perfect! Has the trendy Sherpa thing going on but not too fluffy. The lining made it soft and cozy to wear and even though it didn't feel very thick it kept me perfectly warm! I wore it dressed up going out and to work and super casual with jeans and sneakers.

I wore this on vacation for multiple days. Comfy, knee length, easily fits over sweaters, the olive green goes with everything. It runs a little big but over my sweaters it was ok. Good for 40 degrees but on chillier nights, it was a little cold.
Super cozy. Quality product - very well lined. Wore this quite a few times. Didn't love how it photographed. I got a size 1 which I'm assuming is a XL.

links_reviews_title: One of my Favorite Rentals so far!
links_reviews_text: This jacket is right on trend, and perfect for Fall. I was very tempted to buy it!

It's the perfect "oversized" long sherpa jacket for a cold fall day. Super soft (came new with tag) and the olive green is perfect for The season. Wore it more than 4x. Only con, wish I could afford to buy.
was really big especially in the shoulders and didn't look good on me
Chic and a great cut. MUCH better in person than in pics. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Cozy, flattering, and went with everything.
links_reviews_text: one size fits all so loose but cut in a way that feels feminine
Great fit, very cozy and the lining felt super luxurious. I only returned after a couple wears because I needed to rent multiple dresses for an event! Would def rent again and probably will!
I really like that coat, it should be part of my wardrobe. I am honestly thinking about buying it.

links_reviews_title: If you are petite it's not the coat for you
links_reviews_text: Huge... it would be best for someone tall

Comfy, oversized- maybe a bit too oversized. The shoulders were a bit droopy so I would consider sizing down for a better fit but it was like wearing a stylish blanket so I did wear it a few times before returning.
The dress was a little tight, but was absolutely beautiful on. I'd definitely rent again!

This is the second time I've rented this dress for work. The mix between structure and feminine details is perfect. The fabric is silky and it flows with you as you walk. The print is subtle, but adds a little spark to your everyday work dress. I recommend sizing up. The size six worked better because the top of the dress is very structured with no give. Once the six comes available, I'm buying it!
Great fall dress. Beautiful material, design and quality. Must rent.
Light silky material. Shoulders a little binding if you need to move around a lot, which I don't for work. Comes in nicely at rib cage so quite flattering. Length just below knee. Really pretty!

links_reviews_title: This may be my favorite rental ever
links_reviews_text: I hate to send this back- wish I had another opportunity to wear it! Runs small - has no give so size up. Got a 14 instead of my usual 12 and it fit perfectly. Was so flattering and comfortable. Loved it.
This dress fit like a glove and was perfect for work.

Usually I'm a 10 but this 12 worked well, I think because I'm a bit busty. If you don't have broader shoulders and/or are busty your regular size will probably be fine. No stretch, which is why I mention it.
I had been wanting to rent this forever but once I finally did, I found it a little dowdy looking. It's a heavy fabric which is lovely, but it was a little too matronly for me.
I'm about 4 months pregnant. I would usually wear the 14, but sized up to the 16 to accommodate my belly. The dress fits very nicely. It doesn't have much elasticity to it.

links_reviews_title: Tight in natural waist but adorable
links_reviews_text: Tight in waist and shoulders but still went with my normal size, because I tend to be on the smaller end of my size. Suuuper cute just not the MOST comfortable due to fit.

I sized up in this dress, and I'm glad I did. My shoulders are quite broad and while the dress fit everywhere else, it was a little tight across the top when I'd be reaching up. I was shocked that the rest of the dress was so flattering. The black detailing in the bodice really highlighted by shape in a flattering way. It's also quite long, I'm 5'9 and the hem ended right below my knee.

links_reviews_title: I wish I hadn't sized up
links_reviews_text: I am a 10 in dresses, hourglass with ample bosom and arms. I sized up based on other reviews and wished I had ordered my true size. The dress fit ok, but there was an inch or more of space at the rib cage so it didn't fit my figure as I'd have liked and I didn't love it as much as I might have. It's a beautiful, classy, dress. Great length (hem and sleeves) for taller ladies. Loved the fabric and the sleeves. Felt like I was truly wearing something expensive and got compliments.
Flattering, great length, hard to move arms
Very tight in chest. I was unable to lift my arms above my shoulders, but other than that it was comfortable. It fit well and I liked the length (just above knee).

Classy, fun, flattering - love this dress all around. It definitely runs small in the ribcage area - if you're between two sizes, I'd size up. But it is a great dress for tiny women who have trouble finding sizes small enough. My only 'complaint' (if you can call it that) is that in some areas the zipper was a little sticky. But other than that minor issue - I can't gush about this dress enough!

links_reviews_title: Pretty, shiny, well-fitting, but tight shoulders
links_reviews_text: I'm typically between a 12 and 14 with 36G bra and this 14 fit comfortably. It is good for cooler weather--the fabric was thicker than I expected with a pretty shine to it. It fit well around my waist, though it puckered a bit at the zipper around the hip (you can see a little in my straight-on photo). The shoulders were very tight, but fortunately I had no real need to lift my arms up or carry anything that day.

I received many compliments on this dress! Beautiful fabric and fit. Nice fall/winter dress. It fit my curves perfectly and made me appear slimmer. Definitely hid the tummy. If you have large breasts this might be an issue as it is structured up top and though my 36 C breasts fit well, a larger chest could be constricted.
Beautifully cut, if you're busty err on the side of sizing up. Polished, high end look and very comfy, surprisingly
I felt so pretty and fancy in this dress. I wore out to dinner and to work. Fits true to size, but a little tight in the upper arms. Got lots of compliments!

links_reviews_title: The girls in the office LOVED it!
links_reviews_text: I received many compliments for this dress: Beautiful cut and fabric. Everyone loved the detail. Will rent again for Fall!
Not too much give but fabric awesome and sized up to the 2 which was perfect.

links_reviews_title: Great print but tight in the shoulders
links_reviews_text: This dress is a full, heavy silk, so I wouldn't recommend for summer. Length is good for work. It has weird zips at the sleeves which when open make it a bit better on the shoulder tightness. Cool print!
I felt beautiful, but boy was it constricting! I have a 36 C chest and it was super right around my ribs as well. Great dress with wonderful flow from the chest down but wow up top was difficult.

This dress was a knock-out. Looks so much better in person. The fabric is silky and flowy, and the details of the dress are just WOW. I wished I could have worn a size down - the 16 was noticeably too big, especially in the sleeves and waist (bust was probably ok) but they didn't have the 14 available so I just went with it. I'm an hourglass figure (with an extra twenty minutes thrown in!) and these kinds of dresses aren't always flattering on me, but this one was just so lovely. Compliments all day. Fell below the knee a bit - which was perfect for my event - a bar mitzvah that included a service in a religious synagogue. Wanted to buy it, but it was a tad too expensive even with the discount. I would have needed to tailor it since this wasn't my size.
Usually a size 4, after reading reviews went with size 6. Great dress!!!
This size was very tight in the waist - actually more like the ribcage. I'd order up one size if I rented again. Pretty but really conservative. Needs sexy heels to jazz it up a bit.

links_reviews_title: Pretty, but SIZE UP at LEAST 1 size!
links_reviews_text: This dress is super pretty. I wore it to work and received so many compliments. You HAVE to size up potently 2 sizes: the rib cage and arms are very tight. I'm normally a 0, I'm size 2 when people say it runs small. I ordered a 2 and wish I had ordered a 4. Although the 2 fit, my rib cage was squashed all day and it hurt after the end of 10 hours. However, it's very flattering, soft, and a great pattern. I will Rent it again.

This dress is a beautiful silky material that is very flattering. The areas of black piping detail have no stretch or give so the upper body is a little tight on someone broader like me, otherwise the dress is quite comfortable. I"m 5"4 and the dress hit just below my knees. Definitely will be renting this again!

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a baby shower as well as dinner and drinks with friends!
links_reviews_text: I normally wear a 0,2, or 4, depending on the brand and fit of the dress (I have a very small waist- 24.5). After reading the reviews, some suggesting to size up 2 sizes, I (hesitantly) opted to order the 4 and the 6. The 4 fit perfectly and I loved how it looked for the baby shower I attended that morning. However, the material did wrinkle easily on the backside of the skirt, and it had zero give, so I opted to switch to the size 6 for dinner that night with friends. It was longer and looser in the waist (a little baggy almost) but was a little more "relaxed" fitting for a dinner and drinks, which I appreciated. In the picture above I am wearing the size 4. I would say this dress runs small for LK Bennett, as I own another dress in a UK 6/US 2 that fits me about the same. My husband had to zip it up at the top and commented how much he loved it- it's a really pretty dress! I paired it with black tights, suede heeled boots, a Burberry trench and black Chanel clutch.
Very pretty, great fabric - little tricky to zip, so went with 6 instead of 4. This worked for a retirement dinner and charity event in the same night!

This dress runs small in ribcage and waist. No stretch. I sized up one and it was still a tad too tight but wearable. Hit an inch below knee 5ft7. Great print and cut. Satin shiny finish. Little zips at wrists. Good details.
Planned to wear this with a black blazer to work but couldn't even get the 2 zippered! Size up.

It was my first time wearing an LK Bennett dress but always a huge fan of her shoes! Like her shoes, these are European sizing and so like every review I read, the top (shoulders, chest, arms) were a bit snug but manageable! The bottom of this dress moves so well and the fabric has a touch of shine to make it festive. Loved this one!
The quality is great. Very flattering.
Will probably rent again. Liked everything about it. Not usually a fan of puffy sleeve details, but the cuffs aren't over the top and I was cool with them.
Great fabric and pattern, but no stretch in detail below bust line and high waist

I've rented other LKB dresses in a 14 but the 16 in this one felt smaller somehow. Wasn't crazy about it. Was thinking it would be one of those "prettier in person" fabrics but I just wasn't into it. Felt restrained wearing it, especially in the bust.
Lovely dress, fit well.
I didn't have high expectations- but loved this dress! Very flattering. Just make sure to size up. It was a perfect fall dress
cropped length in a thick knit with a bold animal print. pair with high-waisted pants or layer over a slip dress. luxurious material feels super high-end.

Second Proenza rental. Loved my other red sweater. Didn't like this one as much. Was a bit too cropped (I'm 5'8) and sleeves were short. Wondering if it shrunk due to too many sessions at the dry cleaner. I would recommend to size up.

links_reviews_title: Heavy and nice sweater. Cropped at waist
links_reviews_text: I probably could have gone a size smaller but was hoping a larger size would be less cropped - it was not. The sweater is very heavy and great quality. It's really beautiful close up. From far away may he harder to tell it's designer or such good quality. I recommend, particularly if you don't mind wearing cropped. My abs aren't quite there yet!
Cute and fits true to size, cropped enough that you need high waisted jeans, too heavy for summer so returned quickly
Super fun. Short for me but I wore with a black undershirt and really enjoyed the boldness of the print

links_reviews_title: So cut, they only had a medium and I usually wear small. So glad because I liked the bigger fit.
links_reviews_text: It runs small. Loved it with high waisted black jeans.

So maybe I have a long torso but the crop of this sweater is too much for me, even with my highest waisted jeans. I had to wear a tank under it which I feel like ruins the effect. It's a nice heavy material and fun pattern but I wouldn't rent again.

links_reviews_title: One of my favorite rentals so far!!!!
links_reviews_text: OMG I LOVE THIS! It was so much fun to wear! It is a true crop sweater, so keep that in mind. I am 5'3 and it hit right at the beginning of my hip bone, not too far below my belly button. It looks great with very high waisted stuff. I wore it with a pair of black palazzo pants and also with jeans and yoga pants. It transitions perfectly from casual to going out! The knit is very tight and heavy, and I found the neckline to be a little constricting at first, but then you get used to it. All in all a win!
Had to wear this with a tank under like others have said. Wish it was longer. But still liked wearing it and got compliments!
I love the cropped length looks great with high waist jeans!
runs super small, definitely order one size up because it's v cropped
Beautiful, well made, perfect condition but too cropped for me. I didn't wear it.
Cute sweater, but it's very stiff and small. Would possibly rent again 2+ sizes up from my normal size.

Wore this great sweater along with my oversized wide leg pants for a sophisticated cool look for a client meeting. The match was perfect and received compliments all day and through the airport. Great sweater!
The knit weight feels amazing but is breathable- got lots of compliments! Pleasingly oversize. More cropped than I thought, would wear with higher waisted pants next time
Looks like the model, fits like a garbage bag
great fit, more of a crop top then the picture shows the sweater goes above my belly
I wore this out with high waisted Levi's for a casual night out but felt like the neck was choking me the whole time! It's a heavy fabric and very cropped, which I liked but the neck drove me crazy!
Love this little cropped sweater. Will definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: I liked this sweater but it is too short! It fit me perfectly except the length. Sadly, I didn't
links_reviews_text: Too short.
The medium was a little big under the arms but I think it helped with the cropped length. I wore a black tank underneath. Lots of compliments!
Not actually warm but a bit heavy for summer weight items. Quite short and voluminous sleeves were hard to balance in silhouette
Really cute heavy crop sweater. I love that it's different than something I'd typically buy and it's fun to wear! Definitely cropped, I wore with super high waisted pants.

oh man, this was so cropped. like. weirdly cropped. i wanted to love it-- i liked the weight, the pattern was kinda ok-- but it was so short, i literally went out and bought a t-shirt on my lunch break and wore that back to work. :(

this is not a sweatshirt. this is a knit sweater. however the structure is that of a sweatshirt. it is super thick and very very warm. more cropped than the photo but not as cropped as I have read in the reviews. Very polished look which is not always easy to do with animal print. i love that it can be casual or dressy. can replace a jacket in the spring or fall.
Will end up returning this with out wearing it. It is very boxy and much more cropped than I thought it would be.

I enjoyed the print and the weight of this sweater - definitely on the thicker side without being bulky, and warm enough to wear without layering/a jacket on spring days. I found it to be a little too cropped for my liking, which was enhanced by the waistband. I think I would've liked the cropped style more if the sweater hung loose, but with the band it kept riding up and it was difficult to find the right high waisted pants for it. Ended up wearing twice, pairing with high waisted cargo pants and high waisted tailored culottes for work. Probably wouldn't rent again.

Absolutely gorgeous sweater/sweatshirt with thick fabric, stunning tiger pattern, and beautiful cut. I've worn this with both high-waisted jeans and a dressier skirt and it looks great! The XS fits well through the body but be warned that the length is very cropped, even on me and I'm super short. The sleeves stop a few inches above the wrist as well, which I like, but might look odd on a person with longer arms.
Def cropped def fun def rent this!
I got the small but should have gotten the medium. Cute and good quality but definitely cropped.

Cute pattern, but it was so cropped that it sat two inches above the button of my super high waist jeans. Not a flattering length. I wore a shirt tucked in under it which didn't look quite right. Couldn't make it work.
Wore this several times over the course of my rental, each time with high-waisted pants as it is a true crop top. a stunner and feels great on, heavy but not too warm. Quite a statement print!

I am a petite person and this sweater was just wrong in all the ways. I normally wear an XS in sweaters, but read the reviews and ordered a S hoping it would give more coverage. Nope. When I lifted my arms up, it went up all the way to the bottom of my bra line. Could I have worn it with a tank underneath like some of the reviews said? Yes, technically. But even then, arms out to the side, this sweater has a comical shape. Maybe it has shrunk over time but it, in my opinion, unwearable.
Pretty cropped, but perfect for high waisted jeans. Work it with right black pants and boots and got a lot of compliments. Very thick so only wear it when it's cold!

links_reviews_title: Pattern is great. Be warned- very cropped
links_reviews_text: I actually really liked this sweater- but be warned, it's much more cropped than pictured, even at 5'2.

This sweater is so cute! VERY cropped as other reviews noted, it will show skin even with high waisted jeans. I paired this with black overalls for work which hid my otherwise exposed mid-section, but later paired this with black high-waisted jeans on the weekend. The material is extra thick, and the sleeves are somewhat roomy so be warned that this won't fit well under a fitted jacket.

gets a little stretched out but perfect statement sweater to make a bleh sweater and jeans day funky and cool. pretty darn cropped- be careful about lifting your arms up. or throw over a dress for maximum coverage!
Great quality, however the style is cropped in length. Looks cute paired with high waist jeans.
Love this sweater- think material and incredible construction. VERY cropped on me, wore with a high waisted pencil and was thrilled. Can't wait to rent again
Heavy fabric, cropped, sexy fit. You can wear high waists or mid-rise, but be ready to pull if you dont like your mid-section showing. Lots of compliments. Great look.

Really like these earrings. They were definitely bigger than I thought they were going to be so I wouldn't wear them every day. They are also a bit heavy so be forewarned. Loved how they look but would not be able to wear them all day long.
Light weight, pretty earrings that were so fun to wear! These dressed up an LBD but could also add some spice to a tee and jeans.
These were even better in-person! Very lightweight for being real earrings and not clip-ons. Super cute and went well with everything!
Really cute Lightweight and flattering Lots of compliments
Perfect size, weight, and details. Look like a very expensive pair of earrings on. The gold is so pretty.
Loved these earrings-great size without being too heavy and received many compliments.

links_reviews_title: Wore these to holiday parties with glittery gold pants and white top. Outfit maker!
links_reviews_text: Love these nice big, light, fun earings! 3 inches top to bottom...so fun

I don't normally wear earrings of this size but they are pretty light for as large as they are and easy to wear. I wore these both with the Tonya Taylor Gylda top and the Stine Goya Clara dress and received several compliments.
This is such a great and unique sweater… It was perfect for a snowy day and lots of zoom meetings.
Loved wearing in this sweater. It's warm, but not bulky. And very stylish.
Super warm and cozy.

I rented this sweater to wear to work and it was suddenly warm in San Francisco! Rather than return it unworn (it was too cute for that) I saved it for a work trip to Chicago. As luck would have it Chicago was also unseasonably warm BUT that is still colder than SF! I loved this sweater, the scarf part didn't bother me at all and I had no issues with fit. Might come back and buy it later!
Gorgeous and Bulky, but perfect for a cool winter's Day. The long scarf is attached, so that can get annoying, but I didn't mind.

Based on the reviews I knew the scarf would be problematic! But I was ready! I used a safety pin to pin it to the back of the sweater so it wouldn’t keep falling down. I had zero problems with it. The sweater fits really big. Again based on the reviews I knew to size down and the sleeves were still long & roomie. My only concern with it as well as any other knit from RTR, they ALL begin to peel & knot up. For a full retail price of $800 with a possible consideration of purchasing @ $600, I want my sweater to look 100% unworn. The sweater wasn’t terrible but you could tell it had a few wears... However if you want that wow factor & to experience unique fashion, this is it! Go for it.

This sweater was bulky, but it was WARM! It was perfect for a fall night outside. As others commented, the scarf was a little annoying, and got in the way at times. Overall, it wasn't the most flattering sweater, but it was cozy and warm and just what I needed for a chilly night outside.

I initially laughed a lot when I took this out of the bag because the "scarf" just looked like a giant tube for your head or body and I didn't understand it at all. It was a little bit scratchy/itchy to wear but was otherwise comfortable and casual, yet it still looked elevated. It looks as pictured. Runs large but that is the fit.

Loved the idea of this sweater but the execution was lost on my body. It was stupid short and didn't sit right. A much better option for a short, petite girl who can really have the sweater hang in all the right places.

VERY warm sweater. There's an attached scarf that's isn't very obvious in the picture that would make this sweater hard to wear under a coat and it could be too warm to wear inside but if you have an outdoor event or ski lodge type environment this sweater would be great. I really enjoyed wearing it
Fun and unique

I'm obsessed with this sweater. Easy to wear. Wore it several times. Warm but not too warm. Nice color- darker than expected. Didn't think the scarf was heavy. Only downside was stuff stuck to it very easily.

I wore this with a skirt and boots, but also with jeans. This is very soft and cozy. You can use the attached scarf like a head wrap or a neck scarf. The detail On this piece are lovely. The buttons really unbutton, so there is a teensy flap knit along the line giving it visual depth. On the back there is a little deliberate asymmetry that adds flair. And it's a beautiful color.
Buttons do not actually button. Scarf is an extension of the sweater. Hit at a nice length on torso.
Love it !
It's warm and bulky
Scarf bothered me a little but liked it overall.

Soft, warm wool and cashmere in an unusual colorway with an attached scarf and button details make this sweater a really unique and luxurious piece. It has the softest hand and really distinct details. This piece is oversized, but I don't think it would work if you sized down and tried to make it tighter. It's just meant to be large and cozy. Love it.
Received many compliments! The colors and buttons were very unique. Kept me warm with the scarf. It could get in the way sometimes, but overall wasn't very bothersome
Cool, interesting, very warm.
Wasn't crazy about the fit- too boxy
The attached scarf made this piece awkward and hard to wear. I retuned it before waking out of the house because it didn't make me feel confident.

links_reviews_title: The wrap scarf is amazing fun!
links_reviews_text: perfect fit, extremely warm and unique. Took it on a ski trip and got many compliments. The scarf is huge and so much fun.

I LOVE this warm cozy sweater. I got multiple compliments when I wore it. I know some other folks felt like the scarf collar was a bit unruly, but I found it totally manageable. It would be perfect for fall. And I wore it under my coat on a freezing NY day. And despite being thick and warm, it's not too oversized. LOVE.
Excellent fit!
The sweater was a over the head and not a button up.

links_reviews_title: The scarf portion made it somewhat uncomfortable to wear
links_reviews_text: Like some other reviewers mentioned, the long scarf hung heavily and i had to adjust often - would be great without that thing attached!
Cozy

So I ended up not wearing this due to other circumstances, but I wish I had. It's a soft, warm sweater that is really interesting. The scarf detail is a little overwhelming but for a cool fall day where you don't need a coat but something a little warm this would be great.

links_reviews_title: Cozy, warm but felt a little too worn
links_reviews_text: The fit was great, and the attached scarf which I thought may be too heavy around my neck all day was quiet comfortable. The only slightly annoying part was overall the garment felt a bit too worn, a few pills etc.

I was so intrigued by this sweater! I wanted to love it. But it's just awkward. Once you do get it into place, the scarf neck constantly falls down. I never made it out of the house, it was so frustrating. Bummer because the colors and style are so cute. Maybe with a big broach I could have made it work.
The cut unfortunately wasn't just oversized- it looked a bit sloppy.
Wore this in cool Northern California weather and it was perfect. Really comfortable, unique and stylish, got tons of compliments. If it wasn't so pricey and a bit worn already I would purchase!

I loved this sweater, I even considered buying it. It's very warm, with a great color and comfy, flattering fit. The scarf fell down quite a bit (especially in the wind), but it definitely added a lot of flair to the sweater. I wore it a few times, all on cool fall days with just a t-shirt underneath. It'd be difficult to wear with a jacket as it's bulky, but would do well under a cape. Lots of compliments.
Would have been fine for a weekend but not for work As I was hoping. Too bulky and don't fall Exactly right.
Didn't like the fit or the neck.

Odd fit. The scarf part when wrapped is very heavy, almost causing a weight imbalance which noticeably pulls you towards one side. Also, one of the arms is much longer than the other, without pushing it up like in the model pic it's around 8 inches longer than the other sleeve and actually reaches almost to your knee
its a very nontraditional over sized warm sweater that pays in compliments!
The color, fabric, and fit are all very special. The attached scarf can be tricky/awkward, but it also makes the sweater special.
It's was cute. It fits super large
Nothing terribly exciting about this sweater. Fit true to size, well made.
Wide sleeved, bold pink, two different cheetah prints mixed into one (on the sleeves) Warm fabric knit that is kind of a sweatshirt/sweater hybrid

Not too heavy but feels like it will keep me warm. I'm really digging the leopard print! Sweater is loose fitting but I prefer that. I found it interesting that they have a medium/large size. I went with that and it's exactly how I like it to fit
A loose fitting sweater with a different take on leopard print. Warm, but not too warm. Soft, not itchy. Loved this sweater!
Easy to wear- great silhouette for nearly any bottom-

Great sweater for everyday. Not too heavy interns of temperature and weight. It fell right at my waist so it was easy to tuck in and style, but you would need a cami if you wore with low rise pants. The pattern is easy to style with other patterns because it's relative subtle. An easy piece- highly recommended!

Obsessed with this. Wish it was less expensive! Wore with black pants and tucked the front in. Love the pop of color and how versatile the sweater is. Might have to keep and wear more before sending back!!

Oversized fit, but slightly boxy then expected, so i put a belt, may be smaller size would be better, its interesting pattern & soft thick knit, i had fun when i found right pattern skirt to mix with it!
Super comfortable. Vibrant color for winter. Looks good with black skinny pants.
Loved this sweater! It was so thick and warm- perfect for colder weather. It was a loose fit but looked good with skinny jeans. Definitely wish I could have kept this one!

I rented the small mostly due to the fact that the medium wasn't available. In general this runs large so it worked with high waisted jeans. I would have preferred the medium but it was fine, I was happy. Fun color and very warm!!
I loved this sweater! The material is great, the color is beautiful! It does run a little big.
Great fit and super warm. I didn't need a jacket when wearing this. Loved the look. Will rent it again.

links_reviews_title: Easy to dress up or down.
links_reviews_text: Soft and comfy. Wear it with jeans and OTK boots or make it pop with some leather. I made this work for date night and the grocery store. Versatile.
Used in a photo shoot but also wore and I'm completely obsessed! So soft and classy, could be dressed up or down. Very on trend!

links_reviews_title: BEAUTIFUL - didn't want to give it back
links_reviews_text: Wow wow wow I love this sweater. Incredibly soft and comfortable - the color and pattern are gorgeous and I got so many compliments! Could wear to work or to daytime! Runs a little loose but that's definitely the cut.
This was just okay for me but also cute. I got several compliments but for someone who typically wears a medium, this was a bit big.
Really nice, thick and stretchy material. Super high quality! got lots of compliments:)
Wore this to work in my new effort to look chick and put together. So many compliments from peers and leaders. The actual print is more flocked then textured.

I love wearing this sweater. The red isn't too bright but is enough color to make the pattern pop. The mock neck is great because it's not too tight, love the loose fitting bell-like sleeves and the fabric is on the thicker side. I typically style with black pants/jeans. Receive compliments every time I wear it!
This sweater is true to size as it is made to fit looser. It is the perfect sweater for spicing up everyday wear or work wear.

I really loved this! Wore twice before returning. The only negative is that the sleeves were a little short for me. I have long arms so it's not uncommon. If the sleeves were a bit longer I would have bought it.
Fit was large and boxy but cute print and cozy. Best with fitted pants

Wore this sweater several times - very versatile. Paired with black skinny suit pants for work, wore on a plane with sweats (cute but warm), and with high waisted jeans to a birthday party. Love the print and the mockneck. It is a bit oversized but that is intentional. The material is thick enough for winter as well. Would rent again!
Great piece for work and everyday. Could have sized down but happy with overall fit and style as worn. Would rent again!

links_reviews_title: Wish it was a bit longer - other than that LOVE LOVE LOVE!
links_reviews_text: Definitely a thick material. Four stars at it is fairly short (I'm 5,7) Wish it was less expensive to buy :/ wanted to keep

This sweater was a great vibrant color, I loved the print! The material feels nice and high quality. The top is a bit cropped and boxy- which I think is the style it just wasn't super flattering on me. I still wore it a couple times partially tucked in. Cute but I won't be renting it again.
OMG I love this! Such high quality, gorgeous color, versatile, and perfect! I want to buy it, but I think I may hold out for the price to go down, but WOW

I rented this in a rush after my first choice got snatched up. Boy, what a pleasant surprise! This got tons of compliments, was super comfortable, very chic, and flattering. The 'red' leans more toward a magenta or a cool red, so not super bright, which is perfect with the cheetah print. I would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Comfy & cute. Whats not to like?
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable material. Seriously considering buying since it is meant to be a bit oversized, which works so that on colder days you can layer, and on warmer days can still wear on its own.
Fun print, great material. Very cozy. The fit is a little boxy, so I tucked into the top of my jeans to give it some shape.
This is a great sweater, super soft and still chic. Rented it for work and for the weekend. Will definitely rent again.
Cute, comfy and unusual print!

I am a true medium and the P/S was perfect. A medium would have been swimming on me. Paired with high waisted jeans and got many compliments. High quality material and fitting. Will definitely rent again

links_reviews_title: Winterweight sweater to dress up or down
links_reviews_text: Loose boxy fit is perfect with leggings or slim pencil skirt. Loved the print and color and quality fabric with hefty weight to it.
I thought this sweater was super cute and comfy. I did fit a little big but not overly so. Animal is huge right now and I thought the red made it a little different.

So cozy, so cute, great material. Many compliments. Based on other reviews, I sized down, perfect fit. Wore with black jeans and boots, looked great! Am planning to wear a few more times before I send back.

links_reviews_title: Well made, love the print and color
links_reviews_text: Runs a little larger, tucked the front into jeans. Got lots of compliments
This sweater is really cute and casual. I wore to work once with pleated pants and then again with jeans and sneakers. Great for a cold day. Definitely size down, the fit is large and boxy.
I think it made my chest looker bigger so a little unflattering but loved the cropped look with high waisted jeans.

links_reviews_title: Great pants and fit will rent again
links_reviews_text: Great fit needs a belt though

The material is great and the fit was soooo nice. I would deff recommend this to curvy girls too. I should have bought a belt to go on it but it was perfect. I would buy this but it was a little expensive to buy!
These are so comfortable and versatile. I dressed them up for work and with a sweatshirt for the weekend. Great camos!
I should have gone down 1 size to be more of a fitted style. Other than that, fabric is nice and smooth and they look great!

links_reviews_title: Cute, may need to wear a belt
links_reviews_text: Really liked these and received many compliments. Just know that they are a bit wide in the waist so you may need to wear with an oversized top or a belt.
Soft, stretchy material. Hugged just the right places. Cropped ankle. I could not love these more.
If these weren't so expensive I'd keep them! They fit like a glove!
First timer to RTR! I wore these cute camo pants to dinner the day they were delivered...excellent quality & fit!!! Even my 17 year old daughter complimented me!!!
This is one of the best camos I've ever worn. Soft cotton twill, flattering fit and I received so many compliments.

links_reviews_title: Super Soft & Really Cool Camo Pants
links_reviews_text: These were super soft and fun to wear. They were actually more comfortable than jeans but similar as you can pair them with just about anything on the top and the footwear. I really enjoyed them and felt a bit extra cool wearing them.

I loved these and would buy them if not for the $$. They were so soft but did stretch after wearing a few times; I definitely needed a belt. Paired them with white, black, gray, and even pink! I would recommend 100%.
The fit was a little loose but very comfortable - love the color and casual aspect of the pant

These pants were stylist, the fit was fabulous, and I received a ton of compliments- not just in person, but in a photo I posted on social media. I wore these many times. A camo pant that is really well done!
these are the first boyfriend fit pants that actually fit me. I loved the fit, loved the length and they looked great!

I'm 5'2" and 144lb pear shape. After reading some reviews, I decided to rent a size down and went for a size 6. Unfortunately, I was not able to fit the size 6. The legs fit fine, but the hips were too small. I will be renting a larger size next time.
These pants were super soft and super cute! The waist was slightly looser fitting than I prefer in pants but the rest fit great! Was fun to pair with a sweater and sneakers for a casual date night.
very comfy and stylish. I see how people say they stretch out a little but that was the look I was going for.
They do stretch out as the day goes on. I'm usually a 10 however could have done an 8. Trendy!
I admittedly sized up in these pants bc it was the only size they had, however the waist has at least 5 extra inches to it and the legs and length fit perfect. Sent them back without wearing.

The pants fit great, very true to size but probably better for less curvy women. I can see them being a little short if you have very long legs. The back pockets made my small bum look bigger (a plus!) and the quality is nice for simple cotton pants.

links_reviews_title: waist too big but legs fit. Awkward cut. didn't wear more than once and needed a belt. Bad.
links_reviews_text: waist way too big. awkwardly cut.

These pants were cute. The were flattering on my shape but after wearing a few times they did stretch and lose some of the form fitted-ness. That's when I sent them back. Fit was true to size, and it was a nice length, as I'm short

I had to size down- I'm usually a 6, but the 6 stretched out so much they slipped off. The 4 was a little big in the waist, but tolerable. I'm short, so these were a perfect length for regular pants. They'll be ankle or shorter for taller peeps. I wore them 3 times and lost count of the number of compliments from friends, coworkers & strangers!
I love these pants on the hanger but on they were boxy and unflattering. I think my height (5’2”) might have been part of the issue
I rented these for a camping trip, but the waist was too large.

Everyone loved these. So many compliments when paired with a sweater and boots. They do stretch out as you wear them but they kind of fit baggie anyway. Order a size down if you want a tighter fit. I had people asking if they could see the label.
Great pants.

There was a plush softness to the outside of the pants which was different and nice. I did think they stretched out with wear, though, particularly the second time I wore them. I had sized up for a looser fit but ended up needing to pull them up pretty often. I would go with a smaller size next time. They were cute weekend pants while transitioning to fall.

links_reviews_title: Cute pants, slightly big in the waist.
links_reviews_text: Very cute pants, I got lots of complements; but the fit was a little strange. The pants were a little tight in the thigh area, but were big in the waistband.

links_reviews_title: Love the bold color! Wish they had an XS.
links_reviews_text: Loved it in black so much I rented the orange for Shelter in Place. The bold color actually looked better than I expected on me and was super fun!

I rented this to wear to an 80s birthday party. It definitely fit the bill. One thing to note, it is definitely a unisex fit, so if I were wearing this for every day and not for a specific 80s look, I would have ordered a small. It is definitely a fun, vibrant twist on the traditional Adidas tracksuit.
Love this color autumn pumpkin. Lol. usually wear a size medium and I could probably definitely do a small with this one. Cozy. Loved the pockets on the front with the invisible zipper.

links_reviews_title: B-Boy lewk while stuck at home.
links_reviews_text: I love an adidas track suit- reminds me of my college days when I would break dance at Friday night sigma nu parties and do dance battles with my crew on the weekends. Now I wear track suits to feel nostalgic while I shelter in place. I also threw on the pants during a zoom dance class for a Justin Timberlake homage. Whole suit was cute and comfortable. Style with shell toes and gold chain for the full effect.
Great fit and color. The shirt I got must have been pretty worn. Pilling on where the bra "rubs" on the chest-could see and didn't end up wearing
I loved this mustard color! It's super light and comfortable. It was a tad shorter than I would have liked, but maybe my pants just weren't quite high enough?
Very cute and comfy, would rent again!
This top feels just like you're wearing a sweatshirt! It's so comfortable!! It's a little short, but that didn't stop me from wearing it.
Super comfy, flattering, and the perfect fall color!
Packed this for a trip out east. Wore it to dinner with friends and again at an evening event for work. It was perfect, fit great and was super warm. I would rent this again.
Great color, great style, and great fabric! So comfortable and can be dressed up or down. Great with high-waisted pants since it is cropped. Loved it so much I bought it!
Yellow is my favorite color and this was my go to for WFH! It was super cozy but also stylish.
Fit was perfect and the material was super soft. If you prefer a looser fit, I would suggest a size up though.
Love the color, fit, and super comfy.

Styling: Worn with short tan booties, blue jeans, long chain link hoops Fit: Peplum style great for those looking to wear a sweater and hide their belly a little bit. Cinched nicely on my waist. Pros: Comfy, yet chic! Honestly want to buy, but figured since I'm new to RTR I'd try out some other sweaters first. Was definitely a sleeper hit from my last swap. Cons: I got a little nervous my belly was peeking out when I moved around, but generally very comfortable.
Top was very cute and comfortable, ultimately I think I'm just too tall for it. Wore with high waisted jeans and was still worried about showing my midriff all day.

links_reviews_title: Great color for fall, very comfy
links_reviews_text: I love everything from Kinly, and this was no exception! The scrunchy waist is really flattering. This is warm enough to be worn alone on a cool fall day, or can easily be worn with a leather jacket or vest. It's a sweatshirt-type material, so may not be appropriate for work if you work someplace more formal. For me however, this was great for work, everyday, weekends, etc. Great fall find.

links_reviews_title: Fun and stretchy for hot weather
links_reviews_text: Wore this for a Las Vegas girls weekend. It was fun and stretchy. It just wasn't terribly long, for my long waisted body.
Rented (then immediately purchased) this gorgeous romper for a trip to Las Vegas! Such comfy piece and versatile from day to night. I can not say enough good things honestly!

Loved the fit and ease of this romper for an everyday stroll. The inner strings (that you use to hang) were too long, so I had to check they weren't sticking out of the shorts. Got lots of compliments on the color!

links_reviews_title: Cute and comfy but not very flattering
links_reviews_text: Had to pin closed otherwise I would fall out of the romper.

links_reviews_title: LOVE IT'S SO COMFY AND SO EASY.
links_reviews_text: I wish this wasn't so expensive cause I would have bought it for like $35 instead of $100
I had to use fashion tape to keep top closed

Worn for a casual first anniversary dinner, I love this romper! Secured down the front center with some double stick fashion tape, this is one sexy piece. The fit is loose and I probably could have sized down to a small but the medium was comfortable without appearing baggy. Accessorized with a chunky gold cuff, I felt like quite the fly girl. Would highly recommend this for a casual summertime rental.

Lots to love about this little romper. It's crazy comfy (maybe jersey or modal fabric?) with a lot of stretch. The orange is a vibrant, rich color that's just fun. I would have preferred it had the shoulder part been cut less wide. The shorts have a cute, short inseam and the width of the fabric up top felt a bit out of proportion.
I typically don't wear rompers because I am long waisted. This cut fit great. I did have to use double sided tape at the top as it comes open. Nice color and great material.
It fit nicely and was very comfortable. It really needed a tank under for a little more comfort.
Wrinkled easily but was super comfy. I should have sized down - there was too much extra room.

This was SO big and I had to return without wearing. I always size up with rompers, but I shouldn't have with this one. It was a casual, cotton material and with the right accessories would be really cute.

links_reviews_title: Didn't care for slit on back ran large
links_reviews_text: Pros: comfortable, loose, great color Cons: runs large, I thought the slit in back was odd
Camel toe because of how it's cut. No join in the top so it just hangs open. Didn't wear.
So comfortable and soft. Gorgeous color. Got lots of compliments. The front does drape open so I had to pin to stay covered
It's a loose fit, but definitely ran very large. I could have sized down at least one, maybe two sizes. Needed to pin to my bra to keep it from opening down to my belly button.
Cute but feels like a pajama material. Very light and easily wrinkled.

links_reviews_title: Impossible to where any type of underwear or spanks with.
links_reviews_text: Wanted it to fit so badly. The fabric is clingy to any type of underwear/spandex fabric.

links_reviews_title: The large was too big for me
links_reviews_text: This is a very cute romper but the large was too big. It's also very orange, I could have used a bit more tan to balance it off. Also there isn't a snap to keep the top together so wear something that you don't mind showing off like a Bandeau bra

links_reviews_title: Pretty color but didn't look quite right on me especially the top.
links_reviews_text: I did not know how to secure the top so that my bra would not be showing.
Soft, comfy, good quality, great colour, good fit with good width shoulder and no accidental chest reveal.

links_reviews_title: Cute and comfy. Made me feel trendy
links_reviews_text: I’m 5’4”, athletic build. 140lbs. Medium fit great. Can be low cut with the opening...

links_reviews_title: It was fun to wear and really comfortable!
links_reviews_text: It was a little large but I wore it out anyways. Super comfortable and really awesome pockets. I liked it, just didn't love it as much as I had hoped.
The romper is super long. The small fits more like a large.

links_reviews_title: Would be cute on someone taller, but looks way too big on me
links_reviews_text: The fit looks like it would be better suited for someone tall
Loved these. A nice way to dress up work pants. They get pretty baggy after one wear though.
These pants are amazing, they fit tru to size & are extremely comfortable. Wore for both work & out. So many styling options and got so many compliments.
Casual enough for everyday, but easy to dress up for work or a night out.

Rented these just for fun, to try something different. Overall, they just weren't flattering. The lower belly area would pooch out quite a bit. Fit was good, but style just didn't work for me. Not my favorite, wouldn't rent again. The previous renter didn't return the sash belt with the pants, and RTR realized on the day they were shipping the pants to me. RTR was great and sent me another style that I chose. Customer service has been great, I really appreciate that!

links_reviews_title: Love the strong style of the pants
links_reviews_text: Yes- these pants make you look hippy. I don't care, I love them. They're comfy, breezy, the tie belt is feminine, and they make such a strong statement. I'm between a 2-4 usually, and my bottom is more of a 4 in pants, so I ordered a 4. Fit like a glove. I loved wearing these with my heeled loafers and a simple tank! Great for the humid summer
Loved the fit. It had a little bit of stretch in the waist band which made them super comfortable, and the fabric was light and moved well.
These pants fit so perfectly and felt like pjs! Was so comfortable at work

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love but didn't quite get there
links_reviews_text: I'm wearing these at work right now and they look professional and are really lovely and comfortable material. I wanted to love these but for my body type (petite and curvy) they aren't quite doing it. I love the cropped length, but the hip and tummy area fits a little wonky on me with both some tightness and looseness and when I sit down they create a "bulge" that I don't actually have. Almost there. The ruffle top is cute.

These high waist pant are adorable with a ruffled waist & belt to camouflage the front zipper / pooch area plus the waist is elastic so it's quite forgiving if a bit on the tighter end of sizing (as I was). Hit above the ankle / low calf but paired with a flat /heel always works! Comfortable material & pockets... great to run around in all day! Would certainly consider renting again!

Rented these pants for work. I'm 5'11 so you can see where they ended on my legs. Fit was great except it was really tight around the calves for me (probably because they are aupposed to be more ankle length.)
On my 5'5" frame this fit nearly right under my rib cage. When walking, the top portion would balloon out woth looked terribly unflattering. Would not recommend.

These are comfortable and really flattering. They don't photograph particularly well, but they look great! They run true to size. I am usually a 0/2, but chose a 2. I measure 34-24-35, and they fit great!
Super high waist felt odd at first, but very comfortable and pulled raves from dress shop employees!! Nice!
Big in the waist, tight in the butt/thigh. Not flattering

I'm usually a size 10 in most things, but I ordered a 12 in these and they actually were a bit snug on me causing me to return them. The material is really comfortable and great for a long day at work though.
Really tight around hips

links_reviews_title: I rented this for work but they were too small so I didn't wear.
links_reviews_text: They are super cute but I would recommend sizing down. I'm typically a 10/12 but I couldn't wear these as they were too tight on my hips.
A great pant for work, classy yet young and fresh. Works beautifully with a fitted top that you can tuck in so that the unique waistline of the pant is shown.

links_reviews_title: Unfortunately I did get to wear them. Pant runs small and I didn't fit at all.
links_reviews_text: The fit was very narrow and tight. So unfortunately I didn't get to wear them. I was so disappointed as the pant photographed so well on the model.
Cute
I initially thought these would be too big as I ordered a size up since my size wasn't available, but I couldn't even get them on.

links_reviews_title: Would be so cute but WAY too tight
links_reviews_text: They would have been perfect for work but they were so tight they probably would have ripped if I sat down

The fit was great, very comfortable. The only downside was that you could tell this item has been worn quite a few times and got a little baggy through the day. Otherwise, really quality price for work
did not fit, runs small

links_reviews_title: I ordered two sizes up and it was still 2 sizes too small
links_reviews_text: I ordered two sizes up and it was still 2 sizes too small. Get 4 sizes up. I couldn't wear this item

links_reviews_title: I didn't end up wearing these because they were too small :( too tight on my legs!
links_reviews_text: I didn't end up wearing these because they were too small :( too tight on my legs!

links_reviews_title: The pants were too small to wear to the event I had planned.
links_reviews_text: The material seemed really nice, but I expected them to be a bit looser fit and they were basically leggings on me. I love the high waisted, loose fitting look and was disappointed that this didn't fit that expectation. The confusing thing is that the waist fit well, it was just tight in the legs, so I am not sure if ordering a size up would have made these pants fit better. I didn't end up wearing them.

links_reviews_title: These didn't fit me too well.
links_reviews_text: Pretty comfortable, but better suited for smaller waistlines.
So comfy and I got a bunch of compliments while at work !
Not my favorite. They were a weird fit. Loose in some places tight in others. Also after sitting down they would get creases and wrinkles all through them. The material itself was comfortable though.

links_reviews_title: Cute pants and good fit. It was missing the belt when it arrived, bummer!
links_reviews_text: Great for work with a blouse or wear to go out at night with a slinky tank or crop top.

links_reviews_title: fun trendy pant, I felt ran a little large especially in the mid section
links_reviews_text: I sized up as I thought I would need a larger size should have gone with the 6!

links_reviews_title: Cute but I couldn't find a shirt.
links_reviews_text: Cute style and comfortable. I couldn't find the right shirt so I didn't end up wearing it to work. Maybe another time.
These pants disappointed me because of how high they hit on the waist. They weren't so much a paper bag waist because they went so high and ran small. I didn't end up wearing them.
Tight around my back side; thought they'd be baggier.

links_reviews_title: Loving the paper bag trend! These pants were so well for petite, curvy shapes!
links_reviews_text: I've always been hesitant of high waist bottoms because I am short and all butt. This style is perfect for my shape. This is my third or fourth rental with my unlimited with this style of pant. Every time I wear them I get endless compliments. Because it hugs the tiny part of your waist it actually helps accentuate your curves.

I didn't end up wearing these because they looked quite unflattering on my body. Bummer, because they are such a cute idea. Fabric was a bit flowier than I had expected and they are tight around the ankle. I'm 5'9" and I may be too tall for these to hit in the right spot. I looked ridiculous in these. Especially around the butt- it was insane. Oh well!
They are so comfortable to wear. The material is so soft. Can wear this to work and a night out or on a date. Very versatile . Got a lot of compliments at my work .

links_reviews_title: I loved the top ruffle detail on top. It made the trousers look much more special.
links_reviews_text: I used these for work. They were just way too comfortable!
Not a ton of shape around the waist but very comfortable and perfect top for late summer/early fall

Weird band on arms wasn't most flattering. I loved the high low look with high waisted jeans. And the half collar looks weird with hair up but it was cute and effortless for grabbing lunch with a friend.

links_reviews_title: Too short as a maternity style
links_reviews_text: I liked this top, but the front was too short as a maternity style. It exposed the belly panel on my pants, so I had to wear a tank top underneath to cover it up.
The neck of this top was so odd! I ended up sending it back unworn.
This fit well overall. Loved that it was longer in back. The zipper in back was unique. I wore this to work on a casual day and to a family birthday party- great for something different.

links_reviews_title: Adorable, but looks like a (super cute) maternity top.
links_reviews_text: This might work on someone who is not as curvy as I am, but for me, it definitely had maternity vibes when I am decidedly not pregnant. It's cute and well-made, with nice details, but not the most flattering.

links_reviews_title: Way too short in the front!
links_reviews_text: The shirt was really nice and the fabric was really light but it was WAY too short in the front! I'm about 20 weeks and not really that big yet but the front of the shirt barely reached the top of my pants. If you're super petite this might work for you but for anyone else, it will probably not work.

links_reviews_title: I liked it a lot! Definitely out of my comfort zone for silhouette but very fun!
Great shirt to be able to quickly throw on and walk out the door!
links_reviews_text: Collar can be a funny fit, but didn't bother me and still looked cute! Great material too.
I wore this twice. Once to a warm evening outside concert and once to my kids water polo game. It was perfect! A fun update to the average sweatshirt

links_reviews_title: Cute shirt, runs a little big.
links_reviews_text: I liked the look and feel of this shirt. It does run a little big so be sure to size down. I got a Medium and am a 32DD chest.
Love this shirt. The mixed media makes it very interesting.
Wonderful everyday top. Long enough in the front but longer in the back. Polished everyday look for running the kids to school and errands.

Super-versatile casual top. Wore on vacation, for days out with my kids, and also to work on casual Friday. It is cut in a billowy shape in the midsection, but the arms are small. I wish they were a touch looser, but since the material is stretchy, the sleeve fit is not an issue you can't overcome.
This shirt is really boxy, but it's meant to be. It's one of those things that's fun to wear for a day but probably wouldn't buy, so it was perfect for RTR!

I normally wear a m/L but only the XL was available. After reading the reviews about the sleeves being tight, I figured the XL may be fine. It was not. The sleeves on the XL fit fine, but even for the oversized/blousy fit, it looked too big. The sleeves may have been tight on a smaller size. Otherwise, this is a really cute top that I probably would have liked in my true size.

Super awkard shirt. Sleeves are tight and the rest is super huge and billowy (I dont have notably large arms either). I was hoping itd have more structure or something. Not super flattering. Overall unimpressed.

links_reviews_title: Cute top with interesting back detail.
links_reviews_text: I received lots of compliments on this top, especially for the back detailing.

I think this short probably did what it was supposed to do...if you're 5'5" or shorter. I'm pretty tall, so this shirt was extremely short on me and coupled with the flare at the bottom, it looked like a tent.
Love this top! Very cute detail. Fitted though the shoulder and chest but flares out nicely. Added bonus: works well for breastfeeding.

links_reviews_title: Beware elastic cinching at arm cuffs.
links_reviews_text: My arms are always a fit problem and I usually don't order tops with banding around a sleeve-- this one snuck up on me! It's actually a cute everyday top and fit elsewhere but the arm elastics would not be comfortable, and squeezed me like sausage.

I was looking for something beyond my plain cotton t's to wear with jeans or with pants to work. I love the contrast between the comfy, soft knit and the shirting stripes. The cut is forgiving without being too much fabric. I'm busty and it fits nicely there and then swings away and doesn't cling at my middle, which I prefer.

links_reviews_title: It was very large and the fit made it feel like a maternity top
links_reviews_text: It was very large and the fit made it feel like a maternity top
it is a good pattern
Loved it for second trimester Debating buying it! Super cute
it fit more boxy than i anticipated ....but its a nice top
Arms are tight. Overall look is frumpy. Strange combination of fabric. Doesn’t work as a blouse or a tee shirt.

links_reviews_title: Was little tight around my neck I have a larger neck line
links_reviews_text: Overall pretty shirt
Not super flattering but cute style details
The back of the neck was weird. Comes up high on the neck.

links_reviews_title: This top was super cute!! I wore to an event for church and everyday. I would rent this again!!
links_reviews_text: Cute design! Very comfortable! Fits true to size!
Fits slightly large. Cute, unique top. Wore with jeans mostly. Wore it one day to work with a cigarette pant to work.

links_reviews_title: Super fun top that is a mix of casual and business professional
links_reviews_text: The top was much shorter than I expected but it still fell between the hip bones and my waist. Since I am taller I tend to like shirts to hit at my hips. I loved the back and how it just peeked into the front view of the shirt at the collar. I would rent this again.
Boxy fit that didn't come through in pictures. Liked the color and would have liked the style but was a little too maternity-like for someone with a larger chest. Wasn't terrible but didn't love it.

Very cute and comfortable! I wore it for a day trip to San Francisco and to work. I like that it has the back detail that is a little more formal, paired with an easy and casual front. I paired it with skinny jeans and a statement necklace for a more put together look.
I got a large vs medium because reviews said that the sleeves were tight but . it was a flowy shirt. so if you are in between sizes, size down

Loved this, pretty color and so different. The back portion is slightly see through/not thick material so I'd wear a light colored / skin colored bra. Also the fit at the bottom is loose (arms etc true to size)
I LOVE this casual shirt, sweatshirt material in the front, interesting cotton breezy fit in the back. Casual with a little kick. Loved it.

Super slouchy fitting sweater. Very large sleeves; difficult to capture (in a photo) how much fabric is in the arms. Great for work, and transition to night. Felt like you can only wear this with all black leggings/skinny jeans. Worked great for traveling on a plane. Good piece for ski weekend or workday in the city.

All the way to the right in the picture. I would have ordered the L but it was unavailable so I got the XL since it's intentionally oversized anyway. IM OBSESSED. This sweater is amazing. It’s definitely VERY oversized but that’s one of the things I love about it. Also, one of the sleeves is extremely long (like down to my knees) but that’s probably my favorite part. It’s so unique, fun, and comfortable. Also I got compliments every time I wore it.
