It's big and flowy. One sleeve is intentionally uber long and that just adds to the fun of wearing it. I can't imagine this would work great on a shorter person (just because of the oversized design) but it was perfect for my 5'8" frame. I also felt this was super slimming.

The other reviews were spot on, it's very difficult to figure out how you're supposed to wear this sweater and which hole your head goes in (hint: it's the middle one) but if you can get past the unusualness of it then you're in for a treat. Was so comfortable for a rainy work day and I got so many compliments on it. Also fit under my leather jack totally fine. Recommend!
It's huge, slinky, lopsided and if you don't have your left arm bent at all times, the sleeve basically touches the ground. I get fashion, but you gotta keep some function.

links_reviews_title: Giant and weird in a bad way
links_reviews_text: I really wanted this to work because I love a unique cut but this one just did not work for me. The one huuuge sleeve was weird and I couldn't figure out how the whole thing was supposed to lay

This was one of coolest asymmetrical sweaters I've ever rented (perhaps the only cool, asymmetrical sweater I've ever rented) and I loved wearing it to work. Wore with leather leggings and got a million compliments!

links_reviews_title: Really weird arms but it worked
links_reviews_text: One arm is suuuuuper long and the other was normal. I liked the shape but the one long sleeve hit about the knee. I liked the assymetrical but I would have preffered a normal size sleeve.

links_reviews_title: Not even Sure What this Is
links_reviews_text: Thought it was a tunic, but the one arm hangs down to the floor. The turtleneck covers your head. When you try to bring the sleeve to the right place you get a big bunch of fabric and a short sweater. Completely bizarre.
It is very oversized, but that's what makes it cool. I wore it with a skirt for a night out.

links_reviews_title: Odd fit with very long sleeves
links_reviews_text: The concept is great, but I felt that the sweater was too asymmetrical to be comfortable for me. The sleeves for each arm are different length and this causes the back of the sweater to pull a certain way.

links_reviews_title: Giant and cozy black sweaters are my absolute favorite!
links_reviews_text: This roomy sweater with it's asymmetrical details made a typical black sweater feel new, fresh and super cool. It is a bit heavy on the longer side with a lot of material but it feels like a magical blanket. Loved this!
It was much larger than I anticipated - I thought I may have had it on wrong because of the way it hangs. I did not end up wearing it because it was so baggy.
It's unique and extremely stylish and comforable. I love the dramatically long sleeves!

This sweater is humongous. The sleeves are 3 feet long and the neck is the same length as the sleeves. Unless you're 6ft tall and have very long arms and want something VERY flowy and baggy I dont recommend.

I am a sucker for turtlenecks. I LOVE THEM. Unfortunately, this one was a miss for me. While the fabric is undeniably beautiful, one of the sleeves hangs very heavily, making it too awkward to wear. Returned it with tags on. Such a bummer.
I rented this dress because I was coming back from vacation and after all the indulgences I needed a comfortable dress, lol - this was it! Comfortable yet adjustable with the belt and a fun pattern.

links_reviews_title: Easy to wear but kinda meh
links_reviews_text: Felt like this dress was a little old for me. It fit will (runs large) and was super easy to pack and throw on for a long day at a work conference. But I wasn't super excited about it.
I love any dress with pockets, so this was 5 stars. It's a bit of a loose fit but overall true to size. Love the print!

links_reviews_title: Not wild about the fit or the silhouette
links_reviews_text: I liked the fabric but this just didn't fit right. It was gaping in the chest area and the belt was just below the bustling which just isn't flattering. I wore it. It didn't feel very out together. Wouldn't rent this one again.

I loved the dress: the pattern, the pockets, the ease, the retro vibe. But it just was not flattering on my broad shoulders. It has extremely large diameter sleeves that reminded me of elephant ears for some reason .... and that just contributed to the bulky look up top. I did wear it, but I would not wear again.

Great chiffon material. Cool print. Belt comes separately in a little bag. Elastic waist. No zipper. SO BIG. I rented an xxl which either fits perfect on me or is a bit snug. This xxl was huge on me. SIZE DOWN.
Sometimes I'm a medium and sometimes a large. In this case, I wish I had rented the medium - I think the dress runs a bit on the bigger side.

links_reviews_title: Cute pattern but runs way too big and slouchy
links_reviews_text: I got a size small but I think the overall fit is a bit slouchy. Good for a looser overall fit, maybe more boxy look.
Pros: Pockets! Worn with long black cardigan, tights and booties.
I usually wear a large in dresses but I was swimming in this. I made it work thanks to the belt. Super comfortable, love the pockets, the fabric is a great fall weight. Perfect fall dress.

links_reviews_title: Great fabric and print. Gaping in top, fixed by cami underneath.
links_reviews_text: Easy to wear work dress that could be transitioned to after work wear. This piece works well as a late summer to fall transition piece, and I plan on renting it again in winter to pair with over the knee boots. Looked great with a blazer or cardigan. Overall, versatile dress. I found it a little large in the top, but it was comfortable without looking baggy.
I have a small waist and large hips and this fits very well. I also think it looks great from the back. Ended up buying :)
Super cute!

I absolutely love these, they are so comfy and can be dressed up or down. One of the clips broke off as soon as I put it on, but they were still wearable. I would buy these in a sec. Fabric is breatheable I imagine comfy for warm weather, but I was able to wear them on a cold day and be ok. I'm 5ft and I was afraid the fit was awkward but I liked it very much, added platform sandals for a bit of height with the wide leg look. I need these in my closet forever.

I ordered one size up and they were still incredibly tight in the (high) waist. Fit great in hips and cropped length was good. Very cute except for the fact that I had to unbutton them after lunch at work and untuck my shirt. Not the look or experience I wanted.

Pretty pants and I liked them from the front; but they were too baggy in the back. Made me look like I was wearing a diaper at the end of the day. I was drawn to them because of their stylish nature; but I prefer a more slimming effect in the rear. The wrinkling seersucker fabric was not aesthetically neat nor attractive and did not make me feel confident or classy at work or going to dinner. As far as fit, the size was perfect for my pear shape that has a slimmer waist than hip proportion.

These pants were so cute and really flattering for an hourglass figure. I was worried that my thighs would stretch the top of the legs, but nope! They were flowy and airy. The waist fit a bit snug, but otherwise true to size. Only bummer was that they were fairly worn, and the clasps were coming loose.
Culottes always work for me because I have a small waist but workout and have bigger legs. Loved the fit and rise! Really flattering and a good length for shorter ladies!!!

I loved these pants! They were stylish and comfortable. My only issue was the clasp was loose but I was still able to wear. They fit true to size and were long enough for taller girls. Definitely recommend.

I'm normally a 4 but ordered a 2 due to availability. I have a small waist for a size 4 (26 or 27") and this size 2 works nicely since they are roomy through the hips and thighs. Nice material for my Southern Hemisphere travel (it's summer time there!) I am 5'4, 130 pounds, 34c, 26" waist, 38" hips. Wearing 5" heels.

These pants were SO cute and so comfy. The top was a-little tight and gave me a small pooch but nothing spanx couldn't fix. They were light weight. Wrinkle easy but it's sear sucker so was anticipated. Would def rent again
I wore this over a body suit and an over size blazer with dad sneakers and got so many compliments! I wore again to go out, with a crop top and heels. These pants are so versatile, comfy, and breezy.
Pants are great! They do get wrinkly and at first look a little bit over worn but if you style it right they look great!
These pants are super versatile and comfortable! Would rent again if it weren't already the end of the season. Fastener was broken on my pair, but made it work with a belt.
Truly true to size, since they're so loose but fitted around the waist. These pants are so cute to wear out during the summer! xx Simply Gharib

These pants are great – wide legged, wide waistband, light fabric. Pink seersucker, so the funky shape is balanced by a preppy fabric. They came quite wrinkled so I had to actually iron them (I usually get away with just steaming) but once pressed the typical sitting-down wrinkles that developed didn’t bother me. Photo is after ironing and then a day of wearing to work. Fit: they are quite tight in the waist – I have a small waist and a larger hip area, so generally I am a 0/2 in most things and then often up-size to a 4 in pants, but here the hip is plenty full and the waist fit me perfectly (I’m pretty sure the 2 would have been too small in the waist for me).

These fit so funky and big - I had fun building the rest of the outfit off of these pants! They are really lightweight and breezy so great for a hot day. They have very sophisticated pink pin-stripe and nice big waistband/belt loops. Fabric did have a tendency to wrinkle but not distracting at all. LOVE.
Pant fit perfectly at the waist and was a great length.
Liked it

This seemed like a pretty worn pant... it also was really small in the waist when I am usually a 24 - so wouldnt of expected to not fit from the reviews. Overall super wrinkly and just not flattering....
I wear an 8 and sometimes a 10 but could not wear these because the waist was tighter than was comfortable for me.
Loved these pants! Fit comfortably and were cute.

Loved these pants! Very cute and comfortable for work but could definitely be worn with a crop top as well. They are almost like a seersucker material which I wasn't expecting but it was okay. RTR recommended I get a size 10 (I'm usually a 6) and they fit perfectly
tight waist
unfortunately the button / hook on the waistband was not secured properly, but other than that super cute.
I am typically a size 4 and read the review to size up. The waist on these were tiny! I recommend sizing up 2 sizes.
Such a cute pair of pants. Paired with a tight black top for work and got so many complements. Was a bit tight on my waist, but still wearable. Great for hot weather- material was light and airy!
Felt a little snug in the rise.Combined with a stretch of hot weather was just not feeling it.

links_reviews_title: They are very comfortable and flattering to my body type
links_reviews_text: I enjoyed the look - snug on the waist and loose in the legs and butt. A great casual pant
Fun for summer days. Was more causal than I expected. Fabric was very wrinkled.

Super cute. high waisted pants. Comfortable fabric, light rose-pink stripes. The only downside is they water stain easily -- I wore them in the rain and the bottoms got wet from me splashing through a puddle. The water stain didn't go away :( So be sure it's sunny out and these pants are a dream!

links_reviews_title: Wore it on the weekend and got a few compliments :)
links_reviews_text: A little tight on the waist but it worked out anyway
Too small!

links_reviews_title: great pair of pants for work or a casual weekend! Great fit!
links_reviews_text: n/a
these fit around my waist a little weird.
Ended up not wearing them because the waist was a bit tight so the crotch area looked funny to me.

links_reviews_title: So cute and love the material!
links_reviews_text: Runs small in the waist
Lol i have no waist and am 5'3. I was way to wide and short to look good in that thing.
They fit great. slightly snug above hips but looked great.
Fun pants that can be dressed up for work or dressed down for a more casual look

links_reviews_title: I loved the way it cinched in the waist. I am tall and it actually came up very high on my torso!
links_reviews_text: Comes up high on the torso, definitely flairs on the legs as seen in the picture. Looks just like the photo.

links_reviews_title: Nothing special but comfy. Good for travel as a thrown-on if you're cold.
links_reviews_text: It is light and packable. Nice but plain.
Just a heads up that this is a heavy cardigan and can be a little itchy at times. But it is a fun color palette and can honestly wear with anything. I really liked this and will probably rent again!
Definitely oversized but I love the colors on this! I'll be wearing this a few times!
This is a comfy sweater for these cool mornings in this season of WFH!
While it is meant to be slouchy, it was a little too big and the thick weave made it fairly heavy. Loved all the colors in it, though!
Nice sweater. Runs large but this brand usually does. It is a little bit up with some snags on it but I like it for wearing around the house all weekend

This cardigan was comfy and had nice colors with cream and a blue-ish gray being more of the standout colors. The only thing i didnt like is the shoulders slouched a bit weird at the top and made my shoulders seem even more broad than they already are. Would rent again but only to wear around at home.
True to photos - nice & casual! I'm usually a small and glad I went with XS.
This sweater is oversized and a little on the itchy side if you don't have long sleeves under it. It's warmer than it appears. I wore it to work and it was nice to have as a cozy piece.
Loved it and wore it multiple times

links_reviews_title: Comfortable everyday sweater with great color
links_reviews_text: It runs a little on the big side. I sized down and was pretty happy with the fit. Really liked the colors in the thread.
I loved the length of this sweater and it went with everything! It was perfect for fall weather to wear to work.
Came to me damaged. Can definitely see the wear. Wore anyway for errands but was uncomfortable within a few hours, stretched out .....

links_reviews_title: Oversized and didn't like that the shoulder seams were halfway down my upper arm
links_reviews_text: It was just ok- very oversized!

Got this for NYC in January to wear as an everyday jacket. It was absolutely perfect. The print is fun, but still understated. Got so many compliments. If it was something I'd use year round I would 100% buy it.

This jacket is so soft and warm, it felt like being wrapped in a down blanket. I really wanted to buy it but don't have much use for a puffer this heavy. The hood and neck cover kept me super warm on a rainy and windy day in New York. And the pockets are lined with a soft fleece, that might have been my favorite part!
Wore it to a ski trip to Switzerland and loved how stylish and warm it was!

Slightly snug but super flattering (surprising for a puffer) comes in at the waist. Love the texture of it and pretty warm for cold NYC! Would def want to buy and keep forever if it was less $$ so really a fab part of RTR!

Every coat I get from this brand is great quality and functional. Warm and well made. My coworkers loved this one. On trend. I prefer the plainer fabrics from this brand. Also the front neck was stiffer when zipped up. TTS. I'm usually a medium and only large was available. The large was fine but a medium would have been more sharp.
I love this so much i don't want to return it. Alas, it's too pricey to buy and the weather is warming up. I received so many compliments on this! It's so warm and so adorable.

I rented this for a ski trip. It was a great ski jacket for dry days as it is not weather-proof and does not have a hem adjustment to keep wind or snow from coming up. It was VERY warm! Fit is tight across the back shoulders... which makes it less ideal for skiing in, but it worked. Overall the fit was very flattering with a peplum sort of look. SO cute. Loved the two-way zipper. Would be even better more pockets (jacket has two hand pockets and an interior pocket).

Rented this for a ski trip to Jackson Hole, and it did not disappoint. It's super warm and really cute. I'm usually a Medium but got a large so I could wear sweaters under it and it was perfect. My only complaint is that it needs more inside pockets, but since I didn't ski in it so that wasn't a huge deal.

My very favorite winter coat EVER! I would usually be a size medium and read a review that stated to go up two sizes. I DO NOT recommend that. I got an xl and it is pretty big on me. Since it is puffy, it just looks extra puffy but not huge. I would be more comfortable wearing a large. So, in my opinion, go up only one size.
It runs small. I ordered the medium and I feel like it fits more like an x small. I love the way it looks but it feels tight around the chest area and I usually am a small/x small.
I loved this sweatshirt and almost bought it. I rented to have something cute to wear with jeans. I'm 5'2" and 112 lbs and the XS fit perfect.
This shirt / sweatshirt is adorable but the material was a bit stiff and uncomfortable. I imagine it could be from being dry cleaned a bunch.
Cute, but thought the ties got in the way. A different way to dress up jeans. Was a heavier material than I was anticipating.
very comfortable and cute details on the sleeves to dress up a sweatshirt. the ties on the sleeves kept getting wet when I washed my hands.
Loved this shirt! Would rent again!
Boxy top but cute with jeans—would rent again

links_reviews_title: Perfect and comfy.. not very long but not too short where it rides up.. I’m 5’2
links_reviews_text: No cons on this
Top appeared tired.
short waisted with larger than expected sleeves
This was super cute but fit like it was Petite.

links_reviews_title: Cute casual top, cozy with adorable sleeves. Perfect for running errands
links_reviews_text: Wore this with denim and sneakers, really comfortable with cute chambray detail sleeves.
Very boxy fit and sleeves are short
Nice quality, just shapeless.
I liked the gray sweatshirt part- good fit and nice material. However, the sleeves would have had to have been ironed with starch to not look so frumpy wrinkled.

Really wanted to love this. Planned to wear it to a casual brunch. This top was a miss because of 2 reasons.. 1- too boxy, no shape to it. 2- too short, almost a cropped top look. Otherwise it was super comfortable.

This is a boxy sweatshirt, which doesn't come across in the model photos. I have a long torso, thus had to wear high-wasted jeans so it wouldn't look cropped. Won't order again, but it was fine for a Friday in the office.

links_reviews_title: Wore with leather pants for everyday to evening look
links_reviews_text: Fits boxy with a fleecy interior lining. Shoulders fit on the wider side. I paired with leather pants to add an edgy flair.
Fit was slightly short, but it was comfortable and great with a pair of jeans. Liked the fun sleeves to dress up the sweatshirt material.
I love the sleeves on this top. They are cute and definitely dress up what would be just a regular sweatshirt. My only complaint is that the sweatshirt material is a little stiff and boxy.
Wasn't really flattering but was really comfortable and I loved the sleeves

links_reviews_title: runs a little large on the shoulders
links_reviews_text: did not wear as much as I expected, but I got some compliments every time I wore it good quality though
Big in the shoulders and overall. Size down. Cute sleeves.
Cute. Sleeves were a little puffy for me.
Not flattering at all. A little shirt and the sleeves poofed out so I looked wider than I am. Returned without wearing

links_reviews_title: Didn't love this because it was very boxy.
links_reviews_text: Too boxy for my shoulders!!
It was a cute top! Just a little too small! Should have ordered the small!
Style is very cute, could have sized down. Felt a little boxy in it but got several complements on style. Very comfy, did wear a tank under. Perfect with jeans and loafers.
size 4 was medium

links_reviews_title: Not a fan of the sweatshirt part
links_reviews_text: This was cute on, but it is way shorter than I thought it would be. Also, the gray sweatshirt material was kind of cheap feeling.
I loved everything about this! Wore it to a more casual day at the office and out and about all weekend. Took a boring sweatshirt and made it pop. So, comfort meets style, which is ideal!
Really cute sweatshirt with a dressier detail.
Fit was a little boxy and a tad on the bigger side
Supper comfortable and cute
Nice style

links_reviews_title: It was nice, not for me
links_reviews_text: The fit is boxy and comfortable. The sleeves were slightly pudgier than I was comfortable with. I work for an athletic company so the dress code is very casual. This felt like a good way to dress up a sweatshirt. In the end it wasn't quite my taste, but it was good quality and comfortable to wear.
I didn't love the sleeves as much as I thought I would. Too cutesy.

If only I had known! I actually got the blazer and pants at the same time and was feeling pretty smug about that. But the pants are huge! I got the size 8 equivalent (pretty standardly a size 28 in jeans) and they might even be two sizes too large. The 38 in the blazer was good but still had an oversized look. Hopefully I can get both at the same time again one day...
Just not for me! Nice material. Bows didn't look that great.
This jumpsuit was very cute but the lining stuck out of the bottom of the legs and the material was thick so it wouldn't be good for super hot weather

This photo isn't great but have to review. This jumpsuit is EVERYTHING. I loved it so much and felt so cute in it. It fit really well. It definitely is a bit heavy so if you're in hot weather in the day maybe not. But I loved it and want to order it again!

Very cute and easy jumpsuit. Warning: difficult to zip up by yourself, so you will need assistance each time you go to the bathroom LOL. Otherwise loved it. Denim is not too thick, so the fabric worked well for a cool summer night.

This was much heavier than anticipated! Do not rent for a hot day! It was perfect for my shape. I was afraid it would be too tight on top so I sized up. The zipper was a pain. It's very form fitting around the stomach. Very flattering if you're thin waisted. It hit just above my ankles at 5'4. The straps are super long. I tied them perfectly but what a pain to untie and unzip every bathroom break. I got lazy by the end of the day! Overall, cute and unique. Not sure if I'll rent again.

Oh, I loved this jumpsuit! I felt hip and cute, and found it to be very flattering even though the fabric is a bit heavy. It fit my chest beautifully, and while it was a touch long for my 5'5" frame, it wasn't a big deal. I wish I could buy it! It's so comfy and so cute.

Lovely denim jumpsuit. Was my first foray into the wide leg trend and I enjoyed! Somehow worked on my short frame while wearing flats as well! Adjustable straps were nice and the jumpsuit is lined with a peach fabric.
Beautifully made, comfortable to wear. I could have gone down a size I think. Rent it.

links_reviews_title: Super cute- tight in the torso
links_reviews_text: This was a really cute jump suit! The pants were a little longer than I liked but that's pretty standard for my height. It was tight in the torso area but still fit and looked fine. I wore it to work and got tons of compliments. It's fully lined so it's pretty warm.

When I received this jumper I was afraid it was now too warm to wear it. It is surprisingly cool with a beautiful silk lining inside that caresses you with every step you take. It was extremely flattering and I got so many compliments. I'm 5'1' so I'm always shocked when jumpsuits fit me. I will def rent again!
Loved this jumpsuit! Wore it to a new, trendy restaurant in NYC. Very comfortable. Thick material. No pockets. Worked well with my long torso. Very true to size.

Such a cute jumper. Cut is very flattering. The material was HEAVY. I wore this when I was in New England and it was perfect. I don't think I'd be able to wear comfortably during a Texas summer. Paired with white sneakers. Received tons of compliments!

Adorable and so comfortable. I'm pretty tall and have a long torso, so I always size up on jumpsuits. This one fit great following that rule (I'm usually an 8 and wore a 10). Especially cute for 4th of July and the World Cup when paired with the Sachin red earrings! Will rent again.

I wore this piece for the 4th of July and it was perfect! The fabric is great quality and the top has enough structure so that I didn't have to wear a bra (and I'm 34D). Love the bow details and would definitely rent again!

I loved this jumpsuit so much that I didn't want to return it! It's great for everyday and is a heavier weight than I expected...it has a good lining and is a weightier denim. Only two downsides...no pockets and you have to tie the straps. But overall, perfect for summer!
Very comfortable jumpsuit! I received multiple compliments on this. There is lining throughout the inside of the entire jumpsuit, so I would recommend wearing it on a day that it's not extremely hot.
True to size - wore with white mules - consider the jumpsuit is inthe thicker dude since is well lined

The jumpsuit is very well made with all the delicate little details. The top fits true to size; the legs are wide due to the fit. It's super fun to wear. And the jumpsuit has a full lining - so you can go braless! It's an easy statement piece. Got so many compliments on it!

I'm between a 6 and 8 so this 8 was a tiny bit big but still looked awesome. Thick denim material and fully lined with a nude material (which shows through the little square cut outs.) straps are adjustable and stayed tied.

I rented this for a baby-shower and it was a big hit! The denim is thick yet comfortable and of a great quality. Giving it 4 stars because working the zipper wasn't as smooth as I would've liked. Either way, highly recommend!
LOVED this piece. Would love to own. So much fun and got so many compliments. Unique and flattering

links_reviews_title: Cute, but it runs super small and I couldn’t wear it.
links_reviews_text: Sizing up two sizes wouldn’t be a bad idea.

Loved this jumpsuit - wore it to work when I had to present in front of the company (our office is very casual), and received tons of compliments. The material is heavier but very soft and comfortable, and the adjustable straps make it great for shorter women. It's not super form-fitting and fit loosely for me, especially in the waist and lower half, but wasn't unflattering.

I would have designed this jumpsuit a bit more comfortably if I could, but it was nice to wear for a casual night out. It was larger on top, but very fitted on the bottom so I'm glad I sized up. The fabric is fun and forgiving.
The denim is on the heavier side so better for a summer evening than running around all day. It's a more structured fit rather than loose and flowing.
Great fit at the bottom but to tight to wear
I couldn't wear a bra with outfit. It was excellent quality and it was like a blue jean material. A little hot for New Orleans
Super cute jumper, stylish and easy to wear thanks to the side zip---wore this in San Diego for a girls weekend

I loved this jumpsuit & got tons of compliments on it! The only downside for me was how hard it is to zip up. It wasn't necessarily that I needed go size up, but the denim & lining are very thick especially at the waist seam. This look requires a wing(wo)man but is so worth it!

links_reviews_title: So cute! Runs tight in the chest
links_reviews_text: The jumpsuit is thick and well structured. I found it ran a little small in the chest which made breathing a bit difficult. Size up if you're bustier. There are no pockets which seemed surprising but it's really cute.
This jumpsuit hugged me in all the right ways. It fit like a glove and the detailing gave the denim an updated look. Straps are ties so theyre adjustable if you need to change the length.

I love this jumpsuit. It's so well made and so flattering and just fun. The denim is heavy and there is a nude under layer, so it's perfect for a cooler summer day. I had issues with the straps- figuring out how to tie them so that they didn't stick up too much. Definitely have to wear your hair up with this. Overall, I love it and wish I could keep it!
Really cute pattern and style, just a bit tight in the torso. I still wore it but unzipped as soon as I walked in my front door :)

links_reviews_title: Nice piece but not very functional
links_reviews_text: The zip is on the side instead of the back and the straps are tied so if you want to go the restroom it's kind of a process, more so then any other jumpsuit, to take on and off. It's a thick comfortable denim that fits nicely otherwise. The pants flare out more than I was expecting. Wasn't for me.
This was super cute, fit well and was comfortable. Great piece to wear in the summer. Perfect length too
I could not get the zipper up over my chest area (runs small on top) but the bottom half fit. Unfortunately the legs are extremely wide and look ridiculous on my 5'2" frame.

This shirt was pretty bad as you can see from the photo. It was also a rough material. I wanted to wear it around house but it wasn't even good for that. Size wise ... good. Loose boxy feel that could've had a lot of potential.
I didn't read reviews at all and assumed it would be cotton soft, but it feels more like canvas and very stiff. I ended up not wearing it. It had promise though.

links_reviews_title: Way too tiny and falling apart
links_reviews_text: This basically went just below my chest no farther. And I usually like drop tops but this just didn't even feel like a shirt. It was very rough material for a t shirt which made it uncomfortable and hard to get on. Plus it seems worn in with strings hanging off all over
Very cropped length which was fine but armholes were super tight and tight across chest. Fabric is a denim which is cool, but be sure to size up. I didn't end up wearing

links_reviews_title: Cute piece but best for smaller chests
links_reviews_text: Fabric is a bit stiff. I'm a C and it sort of smushed my boobs. Best for a/b/smaller c!

links_reviews_title: Love it - THICK fabric and really cropped
links_reviews_text: The fabric on this top is thick and the edges are (intentionally) frayed. Its also cropped fairly short. It's a great top to wear with high-waisted leggings and a cardigan. I liked it much more than I thought I would when I first pulled it from the box. It's very flattering.
Fit was fine, it just isn't very flattering or comfortable for me. Didn't wear.

links_reviews_title: Was a little short and showed my midriff
links_reviews_text: It was a midriff shirt and it didn't look like that in the picture
Really liked this. It's definitely heavy and study material but it has a cool boxy shape. Fit is a crop but not too high.
Didn't end up wearing! Too tight across the chest.
Cute crop top that is a nice lightweight denim-like material that holds its shape and lays well. Great casual piece

links_reviews_title: I couldn't wear it at all.
links_reviews_text: I can see how this would be super cute, that's why I still gave it 3 stars. However, it runs so small that I couldn't even zip it up. I always fit a medium, until this skirt. It's tempting to order it in a L because I bet it would be so cute if it fit but I don't like supporting brands that don't do the right sizing, us women have enough body issues to deal with.
Looked cute in the pictures, but not as lightweight and soft as it appears. The fabric was denim-like and stiff to the touch. It's also more cropped than appears on the model. Didn't work out for me.
Cute, classy, can't go wrong!
Coat was great for casual and more dressy outfits. The perfect addition to spice up a boring outfit, or to take an outfit from work to happy hour. Not overly warm, but perfect for a low-40s evening.
Absolutely loved this coat! I loved it so much I bought it. Perfect coat to dress up or down. Not too heavy but still keeps you warm.

I am between a small and a medium and I ordered the small. A medium would've been a little better fit, however, I love it and have worn it nearly every day since delivery. Honestly I'm not usually a fan of animal print but it's been fun. Lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Great statement coat for winter, will dress up any outfit.
links_reviews_text: Ran a little tight under the armpit, but ran true for a medium I could have gone with a large and been fine. Pockets were sewn shut- bring gloves with you!

I rented this for a trip to Santa Fe and got dozens of compliments. I sized up because I was afraid it wouldn't fit over all my layers, and I wish I hadn't. Overall, it still looked great and I loved the bold print.
This jacket paired well with jeans and with a cocktail dress at the same time!
Love a good statement coat! It's made really well and feels good on! Only thing to note is that it's not very thick so if the weather drops before 35... may need something a little bigger.
I am 5'4 and wore a size medium, but the sleeves were not too long which for me is always a problem. I received random compliments all day!
Such a great coat. Very warm for NYC in the winter!

Rent it now! It's comfortable, stylish, sexy and warm. Very true to size...no wiggle room; pockets sowed shut and has one button; arm length was perfect for me; I paired it with the Diane Von Furstenberg red jumpsuit and it was a stylish & feminine hit on a cold Chicago November night. I like it enough to consider buying it.

Adorable coat and definitely upped my fashion game but it was way too big. In coats, I run between a medium and large and because of large chest, I err on the larger sizes in coats and jackets. But, this was way too big. May re-order in a medium. Really cute with black top and black pants!

links_reviews_title: Meow! Loved this coat for 50 degree weather
links_reviews_text: Overall the fit was just right. Coat is definitely not super thick so I wouldn't wear it in weather colder than 50 degrees but it fit perfect over a thin knit sweater. It does not have pockets, only downside!

I didn't realize that this jacket had a faux fur coating but loved that it did. It's more light weight. Like a 50 degree weather jacket, not any below. Adds a little flare to your outfit! I've worn it at least 6 times.

links_reviews_title: Wore this jacket paired with jeans and a turtleneck sweater and got so many compliments!

links_reviews_text: Lightweight, perfect for spring/fall. Kind of over worn.

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it!
links_reviews_text: Got a ton of compliments wearing this coat & definitely stood out :) like many other reviewers say, it's more of a 35-50 degree weather coat (NOT something to wear on the icy cold winter days in SD) but as long as you realize this - this coat is perfection!
great fit, fun for work or home
Wish I could wear again and again!
True to pictures
Beautiful coat. Fits TTS and mine has usable pockets. Not too heavy but still warm. Comfy to wear in the car. Love this coat!
This is so cute, i bought it. Really dresses up jeans and a tee or sweater. It's great for weather over 50 degrees. Not heavy for cold weather.

links_reviews_title: Cute, cozy, and not to bulky
links_reviews_text: I wore the medium , the small was a tad tight through the shoulders and also, the small didn't have pockets but the medium did?? It was warm enough for evening but not too bulky that I felt uncomfortable in it.

I have been looking for a leopard print jacket for awhile now and just haven't pulled the trigger and bought one. So when the option came to be able to rent this one I jumped on it. This jacket was so great, I wore it to brunch, a bar, a show and then out for the evening. The amount of compliments I received from all kinds of people reassured that it was as fabulous as I thought it was. My only compliant is that since I am Petite I wish there was a Petite option. The sleeves were just a bit long and the length while I didn't mind it it would have been nice if it was a bit shorter.

This coat was a winner right away. I plan to wear it almost daily to get my use out of it!! It goes with most of my wardrobe of solid colors, and it's warm enough for the weather lately. It's a little tight in the shoulders but long enough in the arms.

links_reviews_title: Love this jacket and have worn a bunch of times
links_reviews_text: Lots of compliments on this. Am keeping for awhile!
Love this coat with its’ ample pockets and perfect length.

Loved this cute little coat for sprucing up an otherwise boring ensemble, and bonus points for arriving with tags still on. The coat would have been too tight for my wide shoulders with a sweater but worked great over a simple cashmere turtleneck. Lots of room in the body itself and great for crisp, rain-free PNW days. Wore this multiple times and always received compliments each wear.

Two things: this coat fits large. Buttoned (single button) it has so much extra room in the front and waist. Secondly: for some insane reason, RTR chose to seal the pockets shut. Not tacked with thread (this coat is definitely not new and has small signs of wear) -- they used iron on repair patch to nearly seal the pockets shut. What the ... Not cool. Every girl loves pockets, especially in the winter! Like I'd ever BUY this from you.

I loved this coat... i styled it with a regular pair of skinny jeans and a thin black turtleneck... i got so many compliments! I honestly feel like this would be a staple coat in my wardrobe. The material was super nice... not too thick and not too thin. I wore it on a 40 degree night and I was comfortable.
Really cute coat. Kind of boxy around the middle--would be better a little more fitted.
I wore this in the winter in NY and it was great. Granted it was 30-40 degrees but it kept me warm. It's definitely oversized so size down but I loved it and got so many complements.

I rented this coat for a girls weekend in Boston in mid October and it was perfect! Runs large as most of the reviews say. The wool is not very thick, so it was great for 50/60 degree weather. It fits like a blanket coat- not a lot of structure but still lays nicely when on. Would definitely rent again!!

links_reviews_title: I wish I could keep this forever
links_reviews_text: This color goes with everything. Perfect loungey oversized fit!

links_reviews_title: Amazing coat. Super chic and very unique collar.
links_reviews_text: The material is like felt. I really liked it & the color was amazing
I love this coat. It's such a warm, rich color. The fit is great. I have been wearing it all week!
Loved the fit of this coat. Was like an oversized coat. It's warm but I wouldn't wear this for any colder than like mid 30s
Great to throw on over anything. Bulky but tailored fit. Size down - this runs big. I usually wear Small but the XS fit perfectly and I'm also 7 mos pregnant... so it definitely runs very large.

This is slightly oversized, though that is the style. The color is gorgeous and perfect for fall/early winter. My only gripe is that it wasn't very thick. Feels more like a wool sweater than a jacket. @roseandcointeriors

This is a gorgeous coat. The color is a really beautiful rusty brown - I often don't like copper colors because my hair is red - but this one is lovely. The style is chic and timeless and looks nice on. However - RTR what is up with all these useless coats!? This jacket has no lining and isn't self lined and there is one button, no belt or any clasps on any of the neck part or real way to close it for warmth. There's no way I can wear this in New England temps.
This coat is chic and cozy! It's exactly like the photo. The only issue that it is very oversized and has belt loops but no belt! Looks incomplete.
A great pop of color on a practical every day coat! Perfect for layering as it gets colder- wish I could keep it!
Loved this jacket. Wore it a ton before it got too cold! More of a sweater weight.
Loved this and got tons of compliments. It had belt loops but didn't come with a belt though- but not a problem since I loved the more open look!
Very pretty color, runs large. I sized down. A bit itchy, need to wear something underneath.
I would buy this if I could! Very cute cut and perfect color for all year. It doesn't really run big, just an oversized fit.
Really useful to have throw over everything and look polished
Love this coat! Great color. Received many compliments and it went with everything!

links_reviews_title: I wore this for everyday use.
links_reviews_text: It was fine! Unique coat, pretty. Nothing insanely special.
Great coat and color. I sized down and could still fit it over big chunky sweaters
This is a nice wool coat but it is large and oversized as other reviewers have mentioned. It's not built for very cold weather though, more of a transition piece.
The color is beautiful and looks classy with everything!

links_reviews_title: Didn't want to send it back!
links_reviews_text: I got a zillion compliments on this beauty. My only criticism is that this coat is made to include a belt. I wish RTR would trust us with belts! It looked a little young, to be wearing this coat with belt loops with no belt. Otherwise, a stunning, chic, comfortable work cardi.
I loved how warm this was without bulking up my winter looks.

I knew this would be oversized, but the size 'small' practically wrapped around me twice. It was also a lot thinner than I thought it would be. Ultimately, I did not wear it. I think it work better on someone taller!

links_reviews_title: Very cozy! When paired with a sweater, very warm and cozy.
links_reviews_text: Runs very large, size down if possible.

Very light but warm! Loved this coat so much I didn't want to return it <3 wore it so many times during the week I had it. It is quite oversized but it works perfectly for layering or over a long dress. Will definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful Coat, just not the warmest
links_reviews_text: Vince can never do any wrong in my opinion and this brick colored coat is really beautiful. I of course don't want to give it up but it's not the warmest, nor is it lined. Only has one button and flies open if windy. I'm also 6 months pregnant so it is comfy for my bump! I would recommend this coat, just expect to layer up.
Love the color and the drapey fit although I should have rented the medium. Thought that the large would be a better fit over bulky sweaters but I'm sure the medium would have been large enough.

This Vince coat is amazing! I kept it for about a month and was so sad to send it back. It's perfect for fall or warmer winter days. (It's warm wool, but unlined). It's oversized, but looks great for work and casual stuff. I received compliments when I wore it tailgating and when I wore it to a dressier engagement party. The color is unexpectedly neutral. It has belt loops, but did not come with the belt. This worked well for me since I mostly wore it open and more drapey. It has a button closure, too.

links_reviews_title: I don't want to give this back
links_reviews_text: Goes with everything, looks smart and fashionable, endless compliments. Not particularly warm, though, because there's not much of a closure. If I could justify wearing this coat for longer than a few weeks out of the whole year, I would buy it. But really it only works for the several weeks in fall when the weather is cold enough for a heavier coat but warm enough that you can leave it open.
It's a super roomy coat, but the shape is fabulous and is good for wearing over a sweater. I love the color - sort of a rusty brown. Really cool item for fall!
Nice cozy fall coat. Looks good with something fitted on bottom. I would recommend sizing down as it is pretty unstructured. The medium fit like a blanket.

This coat was so comfortable and warm. I knew it is supposed to be roomy (runs large!), so I made sure to order XS. Perfect!! The little neck flap thing does work in keeping your neck warm only when you needed it. The color is burnt orange, which I think is really cute and stylish. This coat has become a staple for me. I'd keep this one for some time yet.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a date or work
links_reviews_text: Neutral, warm, comfortable and well made. A bit oversized and looks good unbuttoned with a blouse, turtleneck or T. Pockets can fit a wallet or phone.

I'm petite, 5'3", so this blazer is prob too long for me, making my legs look shorter than they are. But i loved it anyway. the boyfriend blazer look is perfect if you want to look put together but also like you're not trying too hard.
Nice fitted blazer, received a lot of compliments at work. I'm usually a small or size 2, but this jacket ran a little large not bad for an oversized look

Wore this to a conference and received many compliments. I am a 32B bust size with narrow shoulders, so I wish the size 0 was available. However, after a while I gave in to a size 2 and after rolling up the sleeves, it did not look too big.
Great blazer and looks polished buttoned and when you are standing. There is no closure on top so when you sit it looks really awkward. If you are larger on top size up

I couldn't stop wearing this blazer! It is an oversized blazer and looks good with nearly everything. I am normally a 4, but need to go up a size in blazers and jackets due to my long arms and broad shoulders. The 6 fit me perfectly. I'm 5'9" and the length was great. I also found the suit pants that matched at the store in Chicago and immediately snagged them. This blazer could be the one item I've held onto the longest with this subscription and it's going to be hard to send back.

links_reviews_title: True to size, but definitely a Menswear fit!
links_reviews_text: Loved for work, felt a bit oversized at first but I ended up liking it and got a ton of compliments. I'm 5'9" but I could see how it would be overwhelming on a smaller frame. Would rent again!

Runs large + oversized style. Is a flexible piece: i wore it out with jeans and a silk cami and over a formal dress for work. Has interior pockets that make it super functional. If it wasn't so $$$ i would buy.

Loved this blazer, some said it was large so I ordered a size 4 though my normal is a size 6. It fit me but the size 6 would have been a better fit. I never button blazers but if I wanted to button this one it would be a bit tight

This is an oversized blazer, but I would probably size down next time because it was a little long on me (I am 5'5 1/2"). It is a heavy wool flannel (not Italian suiting wool) so it is very warm, but that is what I was looking for. I would actually purchase it if I lived in a cold climate.
The perfect oversized blazer! A great balance between tomboy and chic.
This is a really great jacket, the fit is nice and the fabric is rich. It fits very true to size.
Beautiful jacket, but the fit is a bit awkward. The jacket buttons are so low (hip length), that when you sit down, the front gapes open.
Oversized fit and thick fabric. Am 5' 9" and felt overwhelmed in it. Boxy menswear fit

I'd recommend sizing down for a more flattering (though still flattering) fit. The arms fold easily for an insouciant look that works with either slim work pants or jeans. I found it semi-flattering, but still enjoyed the professional look even if it wasn't very tailored.

This is a great blazer for SF weather--its lightweight yet warm and holds up to the bay breezes very well. but it also can get very hot. I loved the fabric of this blazer, and it went well with my outfits. Good pocket size AND it had the inner pockets too like men's jackets. Will rent again when it is a bit cooler.

links_reviews_title: Loved the fit - definitely fits large, but in a cute way.
links_reviews_text: shoulders are a bit wide- I'm a small lady so they hung over, just a bit. Didn't stop me from wearing it, but is good to know for future renters.
Great fit, easy to wear over jeans and a white tee. I will say the lining was a bit heavier than I expected - best for a cooler day!
Adored this jacket. I got so many compliments on it every time I wore it. It's an instant power jacket. Look great, feel greater!

links_reviews_title: Modern take on classic work wear.
links_reviews_text: The jacket is well made and heavy. It was so large on me that it looked like a winter coat. I am short so it hit me mid thigh. I loved the style and versatility.
Great oversized fit...could've sized down
Perfect blazer for a date or everyday use. Maybe a little bit itchy. I wore long sleeve shirt under

links_reviews_title: Great Piece added to my collection
links_reviews_text: Sweet lining, fit perfect

links_reviews_title: Well made and thick material kept me warm
links_reviews_text: Runs large for sure even for the style. The details like pink button threading and lined sleeves give it something special

This blazer fit great through the shoulders and true to size for a 4. But the bottom was large (even when buttoned) but the pocket construction made it stick out at the hips. It wasn't horribly unflattering but could have been much cuter had this feature been improved. So overall it was just OK.

I rented this blazer to wear for everyday and out but didn't end up wearing because it was huge. I know it's supposed to be and oversized fit and planned for that, but it looked enormous - like I was truly wearing a huge men's jacket. I rented the size 2 and maybe a 0 would have fit better, but still would go down a few sizes for this to look right.

links_reviews_title: I did not wear it because it was unflattering A bit too over sized and boxy. It was still a nice b
links_reviews_text: I did not wear it because it was unflattering, a bit too over sized and boxy. It was still a nice blazer just not for me.

I wore this constantly. To dinner, to the theater, on a date, and for a job interview (and FYI I got the job!). I get nonstop compliments every time I put it on. It's so flattering, so chic, so well-made, and so easy to wear. As a larger-size woman it's often difficult to find oversized/boyfriend style garments that don't make me look schlumpy, dumpy, or enormous. But this one is absolutely perfect. My favorite way to style is over a blousy silk shell tank with a slim pair of jeans or black ankle slacks, and some super polished oxfords or loafers (although heels would be great too). SUCH a winner!
Runs slightly large. Returning before wearing b/c not slim fit enough to make the longer length flattering.
Fit was oversized especially for my height at 5'1".
Great oversized fit, warm enough for what is actually a (somewhat) chilly LA winter, and versatile for a number of occasions.

links_reviews_title: I felt this was too oversized for me
links_reviews_text: The item is true to size but not my style

Wish I had taken a picture of this blazer with a black turtleneck, so classic. Wore to an interview and coffee meeting with jeans. Great oversized cut and longer length even on a taller girl. May be too long for anyone who is very petite.

links_reviews_title: Cute, but too big on my petite frame
links_reviews_text: Wonderful quality and definitely a great top coat for chilly days, but this was simply too big for me to wear without looking like I was dressing up in menswear (and not in the fashionable way). Please note I'm 5'2, this would probably work well for taller ladies!
I loved this with a dress, tights and boots. It was a bit oversized and boxy.

Okay, YES, this dress is short in the front, so if short isn't your thing then I would pass. However, I give this dress a 10/10 for being an easy wear and the perfect beach cover up dress. I felt very chic on vacation wearing this over my bikini instead of another basic coverup, and I did pull it out another day for a cute spa outfit. Loved the pastel colors!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress for vacation dinner-pastel perfection!!
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress for a vacation dinner, so pretty soft and feminine, has a relaxed fit, the fabric is heavier than I thought, but hangs beautifully!! The colors are lovely, definitely rent this!!

I love this dress, I almost bought it because it was so hard for me to send it back!!! It is the most adorable thing ever and is amazing quality!! I felt so feminine and pretty in this dress, it's like a piece of art!! Just beware it does run short!!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful and comfortable but not that flattering
links_reviews_text: Dress is very comfortable (I slept in it, lol) and pretty. However, it's not very flattering. I am a size 0/XS and this made me look pretty big (see pic).
I just felt so cute and got so many compliments and I don't wanna give it back.

links_reviews_title: Do NOT order if you're tall AT ALL
links_reviews_text: This dress was a complete bust. I'm 5'10 and this was literally a shirt on me. I ordered an XL to hopefully have some length as you can tighten in the center. This was terrible. Super disappointed
Would love to buy
Cool design with cut work and lace but extremely short! Need boy shorts underneath for sure!
A bit short but otherwise perfect!

links_reviews_title: Love how feminine this dress is!
links_reviews_text: It was a little difficult to tighten the waist band strong enough to flatter my figure but once I was able to figure it out, the dress looked adorable. I have a large bust and think it might look better if you are less busty (so the waistline could fit at the proper height). Super cute and spring/summery. Lots of compliments.
Loved this dress! A bit short so I wore shorts under just in case. Heavy material so not for a hot day! Received a ton of compliments!
Did not like this item. It is lined, but had to wear a tank top under it because the V was too low for me. Cute length, but that was about the only redeeming quality for me.
Love this dress so much- it’s short, which works perfectly for me! Wore it to a country club and got so many compliments. I think I’m going to buy it!

Cute dress.. very flirty and girly but the lining and actual dress are super short so I wore shorts underneath which came in handy because it was windy that day! I recommend going a size up as the sleeves were a bit short too.

links_reviews_title: I was planning on wearing this to a baby shower, but did not end up wearing and returned this item.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful dress and wanted to love it! When I tried it on, it was way too short. I ordered a size L since I am taller, but I am typically a M in most dresses. Even the size L was too short - it fit everywhere else except the length and I didn't end up wearing this dress.

links_reviews_title: I'm 5'10 and this was way too short to wear as a dress.
links_reviews_text: Heavy fabric!
Extremely short; I had to wear it as a blouse with jeans. But got a lot o compliments on my "blouse"
Absolutely loved the style of this! Great vacation vibe. Super short like everyone else said, but I wore it as a dress anyways. This would be a perfect beach dress!
Amazing condition like new beautiful and perfect for the summer !
IT IS WAY TOO SHORT! RENTER BEWARE.

links_reviews_title: I had to wear white jeans
links_reviews_text: Really cute - loads of compliments, but there is no way I would have worn alone. I bent over and all the goodies showed... white jeans to the rescue

links_reviews_title: Super cute dress, just short and the suggested size was way too big
links_reviews_text: Love this dress but probably for a cover-up or to run around during the day on vacation. The suggested size for me was XL and that was way too big. The drawstring could go that tight to fit. I may try it again in a L.
Felt so fancy wearing this on vacation. The pastel palette is straight out of Wes Anderson land. The trimming details are also so good. It's a lot but totally would rent again!

links_reviews_title: Search web and found it. Want going to buy for 400.00 but thrilled I could rent
links_reviews_text: Very short. Wore it over white jeans. Very feminine

links_reviews_title: Super flattering, received a ton of compliments
links_reviews_text: This dress is a great, loose fit. People literally stopped me on the street to tell me how much they liked it. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: I like them, but the fit isn't perfect for me.
links_reviews_text: Overall they're cute! I love the wash & the denim has structure without being too stiff. The fit just isn't perfect for me. I normally wear a size 25, sometimes 26 so I sized up in these after reading reviews. I got a size 27 and they fit in the legs perfectly but the waist is loose. I could have gotten a 26 but then I think the legs might be too tight. Maybe my thighs are just a little too wide for this cut. They do look great from behind though!
Fit perfectly, wore them every day. Would buy.

I'm obsessed with these jeans and will buy them someday!!! Perfect fit, I have a bit of a larger booty and smaller waist so it's nice that it's a little stretchy but tight where it needs to be. I could lounge in these on the couch or dance all night, they are the perfect pair of jeans!
Love the A Golde shorts do had to try the jeans. So comfy I don't want to send them back. Great every day around town errand pant. I sized up one size per reviews and these fit great.

These jeans could have been perfect if just one size smaller for me. I think of myself as a true 24, but these ran large in the front and had too much extra space around the waist. The jeans were brand new, still with the tag, and the fabric was wonderful - stretchy, but without too much give. Wish I could've worn them in a 23.

links_reviews_title: Too tight in waist and too long in the legs.
links_reviews_text: The pants were not flattering on me. They were too tight in the waist, and did not have any stretch. I have shorter legs, and they just did not fit my body type.

links_reviews_title: Took some time but worth it.
links_reviews_text: It took a nap, about 24 hours of wear and some shaking to get comfortable in these jeans but it was worth it. When I first got them I could hardly button them all the way but as I wore them, and slept in them (weird but helpful trick to break in jeans), I loved how they started to fit. I wish I didn't have to send these back now that I have gotten them to fit me perfectly.

I'm generally a 29-30 in jeans, and I ordered the size 30, which ended up being about 1.5" from closing and the legs were tight. If I try these again I'll get the 32s. The style is nice though. In a perfect world, RTR would have measurements for all sizes available instead of relying on customer reviews to inform about the sizing. edit: I got the 32s and I fell in love so hard I bought them! They do stretch out throughout the day, but they are comfortable and make my butt look so good. Total winner! I hope RTR will get more Agolde jeans!
These were great fitting and actually sat at the perfect point of my waist. They felt comfortable and only stretched out a little throughout the day.

links_reviews_title: Not bad for a short person!
links_reviews_text: I've never worn high waisted jeans. I'm short and just assumed they'd be up to my ears. I'm also pretty muscular and fitted jeans don't usually work but I loved these immediately and wore them for several days straight! Yes, they were pulled up to my ears but i really liked the fit and the button up waist kept things tucked in.
Loved these jeans. They were the perfect fit and length (I'm 5'5). They didn't really stretch out throughout the day. I wore them 3 times before sending them back but I will def rent them again!

links_reviews_title: Runs very small in waist, but loved the high waisted style
links_reviews_text: I would definitely size up, one size larger and these would be perfect every day jeans.

links_reviews_title: I never wore because the wrong size was sent.
links_reviews_text: I never wore because the wrong size was sent.

links_reviews_title: Everyday jeans that go with almost everything!
links_reviews_text: Great fit and quality!

links_reviews_title: No stretch and cut for no hips
links_reviews_text: These were so promising-- quality denim with a nice cut and wash. They came and unfortunately didn't fit. I listened to previous reviewers and went up 2 sizes (32) than my normal size (30) but they still didn't fit. Really sad :/
Great quality denim with just a little stretch. Very flattering fit. They do fit a little smaller than the Agolde Nico Embark, so they were a little tighter on me than I was hoping.

links_reviews_title: Slimming Jeans with a high waist made for a confident fit!
links_reviews_text: The fit is snug and high waisted gives a great feel from work to evening! I loved these jeans. Might be tight on a curvier figure. #snugfit #flattering

Love the look of these jeans. Fit perfectly as long as I don't move. However, they aren't super comfortable when you move around because they don't have any stretch. Would size up and wear a belt next time for a little more comfort.
Usually, I am a true 30 in jeans but I could not get these over my legs.
Loved these. I usually wear a 27-28 depending and these were right on the money. I'm petite and curvy with a booty and the 28 fit perfectly.

I rented another pair of jeans from this brand and they fit like a dream, so I wanted to try these. The reviews recommended sizing up, so I went up one size. Though when I got them, I should have probably sized up 1 or 2 more times. If you have some curves in the hip/butt region - SIZE UP!

I am petite and size 24 waist. The waist on these fit well but the legs were skintight. Maybe the denim would loosen up after wearing a few times but these weren't flattering enough to be worth waiting to see. Good high waist but don't rent unless your legs are very thin.

These were so cute I wanted to buy them the second I put them on! The color is such a perfect shade of blue and the high waist is the perfect height. It had 4 buttons that were hidden below a flap instead of a zipper then a top 5th button that was exposed. Not bulky tho. The length was only about a half inch long and I'm 5'3 so I cuffed them once. The only reason they're getting 4 stars and I didn't buy them was because they stretched out so so much pretty quickly that by then of my work day the waist was no longer form fitting but had a gap and the knees were baggy and kind of sagging which was unexpected. If I rent them again I'd get the 25 in hopes that they'd be a little tight in the morning but then not as baggy throughout the day. I have a very athletic build with thick thighs so I never report back with baggy jeans.. if anything most "girlfriend" or "mom" jeans are fitted on me.
x

I normally wear a 26 in jeans, but that was unavailable so I went with the 27. When I went to try them on I couldn't pull them all the way up because the calves were tiny, but I could tell the they were going to be too big in the waist anyway. So they run big and small. Pretty annoying.

links_reviews_title: If you are curvy these are not for you. I went 1 size up & I could not get the jeans past my thighs.
links_reviews_text: If you are curvy these are not for you. I went 1 size up & I could not get the jeans past my thighs. No stretch, whatsoever.
Couldn't even pull them up past my thighs and I even went a size up.

links_reviews_title: Couldn't even get them all the way on
links_reviews_text: These jeans are very cute, but I couldn't even get them on. I sometimes fit better into a 32, and there is little to no stretch in these, but I think the issue was more the straightness of the fit. Definitely not for curvy girls.

links_reviews_title: The perfect non-stretch demin I've worn in a v long time. Dresses up as easily as it dressed down.
links_reviews_text: :D

links_reviews_title: Amazing balance of a casual look that's still very flattering.
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size, a bit tight in the legs (I have fairly muscular legs) but comfortable in the waist.
I really like the cut of the jeans, however, it is too large.
Good quality but I couldn't even button these. Runs very small.
Didn't fit so I'm returning. Nice solid construction but runs small in both leg and waist. Too bad, love the cut!
They run a little small. They have a button fly, which I wasn't expecting.
Overall great. Worked for my postpartum body. Would have been cuter if I were taller
These were a cute mix to add to the wardrobe.

Big around the waist, not a good fit for anyone with a smaller waist or hourglass shape. Jeans loosened up after a couple hours of wear, but thats normal for cotton no stretch jeans. loved the material and button fly jeans are always awesome.
Fits smaller than Madewell/JCrew/DSTLD by about a size
These run small. I found them to be too tight in the hips & thighs. I also didn't like the button fly. Returned without wearing.
Loved this top for work and weekend brunch

links_reviews_title: Stylish top but a little large
links_reviews_text: Overall nice work top. It is see through and I didn't realize this until I was at work. Need to wear a dark undershirt. I have long arms but the sleeves were a little long still. Nice fit overall.
This blouse fit well and looked fantastic for my work event. My only minor concern was that it puffed up a little in the back but really wasn't an issue.

This shirt is okay. Breathable fabric for summer, I was able to wear it with only a bra underneath without it looking racy. The pattern and the neck ties are okay. Idk what it is with these designers and the super long sleeves though, do rich people just have longer arms? The puffed shoulder also made me look broader.

I liked the style and pattern of the shirt. The top part felt a little baggy and I didn't know what to do with the dangling straps but overall a good top that can be worn either professionally or casually.

The sleeves are about 1-2" too long and I rented the smallest size. I also have pretty long arms so maybe that's the style? The pleats on the top part are not flattering, they make me look a lot bigger than I am, but I suppose if you're busty this would be good? I'm a 32B/C and have a really small ribcage - the bust area felt big on me. Fits great in the waist area and the length is perfect for wearing with legging/tight pants. I'd never rent it again but I'll wear it today!
Was a bit snugger than I expected and the zipper was a bit hard to get up when the shirt was on. I would rent it again for a weekend event

links_reviews_title: Professional, flattering for work or a date
links_reviews_text: Love how flattering and classic this blouse is. Lovely dark, rich colors. Flouncy and tucked in the right places. Fits perfectly.

The top is sheer so I had to wear a tank under it. The top is also very loose and slid around all day. It looks like I should have sized down, but the waist is fitted and it would have been too small. The sleeves were also extra long (usually sleeves are too short on me).
One con is the fabric below the bust is sheer. Luckily I had a deep v cami to wear underneath. No belly button at work!

I wore this to a business conference and it fit great. I'm large chested and have a smaller waist so it complemented that well. There was enough room in the bust and was fitted in the waist which was nice. Really nice and i would rent this again

This is a beautiful shirt. I have long arms and a large chest. It fit perfectly. The side zip means no gaping buttons in the front. The sleeves were nice and long. It is sheer, so I will wear a cami under it for work.
Wore this for work, had a side zip and got lots of compliments. Really liked it would wear again

This top is gorgeous! So well-constructed. It's definitely way more sheer than I thought it was going to be, so don't expect it to keep you warm. I wanted this to work, but it was ultimately just too big. I'm an XS and got the equivalent size 36. I think it is meant for a much larger XS. The sleeves were way too long (and I have long arms), and while a looser fit is fine in this type of blouse, there was way too much extra room so it just sort of hung on me.

links_reviews_title: The blouse shape is very flattering. Wore with jeans for a happy hour!
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly

links_reviews_title: This top looked nice on the model but not on me. The shirt ran small. I didn't get a chance to wear

links_reviews_text: Very flattering (I'm somewhere between "athletic" and "curvy") and got tons of compliments. The only reason I'm not giving five stars is that something about the positioning of the side zip made it rub against my skin and by the end of the day was pretty uncomfortable. Also, be warned the blouse is quite sheer--you definitely need a cami underneath.

I loved this shirt! I definitely didn't realize it was see-through when I ordered it, but it ended up working for me both with and without an extra layer. I wore it with just a bra out to a late dinner and it wasn't overly revealing and I wore it with a cami for work. I found it to be very waist flattering and I thought the long sleeves were a cool touch (but I'm 5'9" so it probably wasn't as drastic on me as some other reviewers.)
Looked great. Snug in the arms.
Cute shirt but I didn't realize most of it was see through. I would have felt uncomfortable wearing this at work
This was a great work shirt. Best worn with pants. Rented this for a work conference and I didn't end up wearing it because I ended up only wearing skirts.

I loved everything about the way this shirt for me. I have long arms, and the sleeve fit me perfectly. It was also long enough in the torso - not too long, but not as short as so many shirts are these days. The v-neck is very deep, but can be hidden by strategically tying a knot or bow.

links_reviews_title: I wanted to wear this to a christmas show, but it was too big, even with a camisole.
links_reviews_text: This was way too large and I had to wear a camisole under it for it to be decent. Definitely order a size smaller.

links_reviews_title: loved it, perfect for large breast
links_reviews_text: fit just perfect on my chest size, and was roomy for the breast, faltering fit. Loved it

I normally wear a size 40 but 42 was ok. It was a little loose in the waist but I expected that because I went a size up. I love the long sleeve, print, and how light the fabric is. I wore a dark blue bralette under and it wasn't see through at all on me. In fact, I wore it to work.
Not impressed. Low cut, see through and a bit itchy.

The zipper on the side bunches up and makes it impossible to wear the shirt tucked in. I ignored the other reviews about the top being see through (I thought it was just sheer) but nope you definitely can't wear this top without a camisole underneath.

I love Derek Lam's shirts and dresses, but this one is not like other Derek Lam designs. The neck in the back is oddly high and there's a seam that runs immediately under the chest, and together they pull on each other to make the fabric tight and uncomfortable. Not for busty gals, but I suspect the fabric might gape for the non busty gals, too.

links_reviews_title: Got plenty of compliments with this blouse. Loved the fit and style.
links_reviews_text: Light weight and comfortable. Definitely a spring and early fall blouse. Great with jeans and slacks.

Really loved this shirt. Wore it to a work client meeting and it's professional and feminine. I typically wear a size small or medium and rented the size 40. I think I could have gone a size or two down to be more form fitting, but it naturally hugs you to give you a good looking curve. No damage, great quality. Definitely recommend!
Super cute top, great fit. Accommodates larger chest. Looks great with jeans or slacks!
As a normal size 8, I ordered 44. I couldn't get both shoulders into the shirt so need a 46
The fabric is a little stiff/scratchy but it draped beautifully. Loved how it looked.
It was ok- but it was too tight so sending it back

links_reviews_title: Flattering, no lining but easy over any tank
links_reviews_text: Pretty colors and style.
very flattering

links_reviews_title: Nice blouse, the see-through waist panel is a bit out of left field so had to wear a camisole
links_reviews_text: Nice blouse, the see-through waist panel is a bit out of left field so had to wear a camisole
Cute shirt but too revealing for work so I didn't wear it

links_reviews_title: Cute but fits weird in middle
links_reviews_text: The fit was weird in the middle- seemed much tighter than it should have been - I didn't realize there was a zipper on the side until I had it on
Love this blouse. So pretty and classic. Great for work, business, etc. the top is tight across the chest so I would definitely size up if you're larger in the bust.

links_reviews_title: Quality is great and the color is even greater
links_reviews_text: I loved this bomber so much! This is the kind of bomber I probably would never buy for myself if I saw it on a store shelf, but it was the absolute perfect rental. The color is beautiful, it fits very well, and also kept me warm in 40 degree weather! The only thing to note is that it's a little cropped, so it's best worn with high waisted jeans or leggings.
Super cute and warm bomber. Incredible standout color. Thick. Great fit and not too tight in arms like a lot of jackets. Wore it several times but it got rainy and warm in Texas. Would rent again!

links_reviews_title: Very pretty and warm in mild winter weather.
links_reviews_text: Cozy. Love the color.
I wore this to my birthday party and again for wine tasting in Napa. Great weight and warmth for sunny January days in Northern California. And I got SO many compliments!
I loved this jacket so much I wish I'd bought it (and might still do so). Gorgeous bright color and perfect TTS fit. Rent this one!!
Loved this cost for a cool destination vacation. Warm and a statement piece
The color was great and it was super warm. I got so many compliments.
It was almost too warm for October in NYC! Everyone loved it. My fiancé keeps asking me to rent it again!
I don't usually love this style of jacket for me, but this was perfect for attending a bruins game. It's thick and warm and just feels expensive. The large was perfect and true to size.
Loved this jacket so much! Great fit zipped or worn open. Pretty warm too, was cozy layered with a sweatshirt in mid 40s. The color made it a perfect fit for fall; a great statement color too!

links_reviews_title: Wore this for almost a month.
links_reviews_text: I loved this. It's so fun, goes with more outfits than you'd think, and is the perfect weight for fall. Pockets in the side are big enough to fit hands or the smaller iphone.
LOVED THIS! Didn't want to send it back! Super cozy, comfy, high end & true to size. Wanted to keep it longer

So comfortable - I felt like I was wearing a blanket all day! I felt very sporty bopping around town in this, but it could easily be dressed up or down. Probably could have sized down, but the slightly oversized fit made it extra comfortable. I'll likely rent this again before the end of winter.

This was the perfect rental for a fall day in Wisconsin. Our weather is turning cooler and this jacket really did keep me warm the entire day and night. I was actually really impressed. The color and material are super fun. I will probably rent this again.

HUGE fan of this jacket. The color was so fun, and it is such a unique, stand out piece. I wore it so many times for so many different looks Fourth of July weekend -- from jeans/flowy top to jean shorts/bathing suit. Also wore to work a few times and got a ton of compliments. It runs pretty large, so not wildly flattering. Going to order a size down next time around.

links_reviews_title: This jacket is AMAZING!! Fits so true to size and WARM WARM WARM
links_reviews_text: Everything about this jacket was spectacular! So warm and I loved the cut of it; cut off right above the belt line.

Loved the color of this bomber! I was sick of just wearing black winter coats and was looking for something more fun. It was fairly thick so still kept me warm and I found that it fit well. It's a great casual jacket that I would definitely recommend!
I love this jacket and so does everyone else! So many compliments, I was like a walking advertisement for RTR. It is warm and cozy.

I adored this coat and wore it several days in a row, when our weather was more winter than spring... it's quite heavy weight and very cozy. The fabric is plush and expensive feeling, and I loved the striped cuffs and bottom. It is definitely cropped, so maybe size up if you're taller, but I loved the cropped look.
Love the fuzzy varsity look of this jacket but ran very small. Got the 4xl which was an 18/20 and was still pretty tight across the back. Wore it open and was a cute statement piece

links_reviews_title: Love this jacket! Warm, bold, soft, sassy. Mustard color is fabulous.
links_reviews_text: Had a blast wearing this for a weekend in Vegas. It was a bold look but still easy to pull off. I felt fabulous and think it was really versatile in terms of style.

links_reviews_title: Kept this for months, would buy if cheaper
links_reviews_text: I loved this retro look and it was warm!! Now it's not warm for frigid cold days but that didn't stop me. It was cuddly on the outside and I enjoyed the silky inside. The color was always brightening my mood.

Fit true to size I wore it with t shirts and lifts sweaters underneath. It's not too big not too small and hits right above the hips. The material feels expensive and is nice and cozy. Color is super fun! Perfect transitional piece for this winter to spring weather. Wore it out with friends with jeans and with sweats doing errands, so versatile!

links_reviews_title: It was the perfect statement piece to go with some items that I already have! It felt so luxurious!
links_reviews_text: The fit was true to size, I ordered a size Medium, and I'm usually a small so it was a littttle big on me but not by much.

I'm a 18/20 and ordered the 2x first. It didn't close so I ordered this 4x. It fits and it's pretty roomy, however very boxy and not flattering for my figure. Also, the collar is thick and comes up high. My neck isn't long enough for this. It's like a double whammy - thick collar and thick neck. Thankfully, the weather is going to be too warm for this so I'm not so heartbroken. Overall, it's a gorgeous jacket! Like the other renter said, it's high end so the sizing for the plus sizes is different.

links_reviews_title: What great burst of color in chilly dark days!
links_reviews_text: Thick, cozy coat offers a colorful way to spruce up your outfit. Paired with a RTR turtleneck, skinny jeans and white Reeboks. Made people smile :)

Rented this for a chilly weekend in Seattle. Such a fun pop of color and really keeps you warm! Love the leather detail underneath the collar. Only issue was the lining had a small tear in one of the seams, but nothing you could see when wearing the jacket. Definitely rent this!
This jacket is perfect for casual cool weather. The color makes it super fun. It has a vintage look.
Super soft and well made details. Lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: I'm the fanciest Sesame Street muppet on the block!
